comment: I ate way too much for a one-person dinner and I paid a dear price the next day during my workout but that was worth it and I WILL do it again in a heartbeat.Kou Rou Bao, though it took a while like other reviewer noted, was every minute worth the wait.  Try it and you'll know why.Gai Lan in oyster sauce goes nicely with any dish if not good by itself.Clams with garlic was a great substitute for bamboo clam.Really wanted to try their steamed crab wth glutenous rice but I'll need to bring more people to share the food and the cost (SGD58).Can't wait to return.

Was hunting for a seafood joint to get rid of some cravings.Fish skin was decent but some pieces were soggy and greasy from even frying. The steamed prawns with garlic was just flat out not good. Can easily tell the prawns were not fresh. The texture was completely mushy on every single piece. The only decent plate was the veggie, which is incredibly hard to mess up. Should have known something was to since there was only 3 tables occupied at close to peak hours. Disappointed at the overall quality of this place, especially since it was a short hike getting to this place.

THIS PLACE. How did it take so long for us to realise how awesome it is?!They're a seafood restaurant but they also do meat dishes pretty well. A lot of their main dishes take time to prepare (it could be a half hour wait, or even longer during peak dining hours) but the wait is seriously worth it.If you're already hungry, I'd start with the salted egg fried fish skin appetizer. WARNING: These are extremely addictive. Crispy, just the right amount of salt, and not at all fishy. Almost like potato chips.They even have a chicken rice stall within the restaurant, so you could order from them if you need something to hold you over while you wait.The crab dishes here are fantastic. We've tried the steamed crab with hua diao wine, and the steamed crab with glutinous rice. If I had to choose, I'd go with the glutinous rice, because that in itself is already delicious.Last but not least, I really love their kou rou bao (steamed buns with marinated braised pork belly.) Again, this dish takes time to make, but DAMN SON. The pork is so tender and the sauce is boss.This is a great spot to go to if you have a big group, as the round tables can fit about 8 people each. Plus, the portions are big here, so they're meant for sharing.

Solid traditional Chinese/Teochew fare at good prices along Joo Chiat Road.First, this place is not to be confused with the other restaurant named "New Ubin" and other similarly titled establishments adopting the name of Singapore's rural offshore island. This place opened along Joo Chiat Road a couple of years ago under the name "Ubin Seafood" owned by the people who formerly ran the original seafood restaurant on Pulau Ubin.To further add to the confusion, in 2012 there was a change of management, and the name of the place changed from "Ubin Seafood" to "Ubin Kitchen". Chatter on the internet forums tells me that the head chef from the original Ubin establishment still helms the kitchen.Complicated history aside, it's possible to rattle off a laundry list of signature dishes that one should order:Steamed crab & glutinous rice (for 3-4 persons at $58)Bamboo ClamsOyster Hokkien NoodlesSteamed belly pork buns (Kou Rou Bao)fried shrimp rolls (hae zhor)salted egg yolk squidfried rice noodles (bee hoon)In particular, the oyster noodles were tender and had a hearty sauce, old school style. You see clams in the photo but there's some oysters somewhere hiding beneath the noodles. The pork buns were a DIY affair, fluffy steamed buns arrive separate from the pork and you'd have to create your pork sandwich yourself. All in all, I had a pretty good dinner.If Dorothy was Singaporean, she'd exclaim that "We're not in Ubin anymore!". I'm just glad I don't need to make it out across the water to eat the good stuff.

Ubin Kitchen is a FANTASTIC Teochew restaurant on Joo Chiat Road. My wife and I came here on Deepavali and decided to try some of the restaurant's specialties, namely the Kou Rou Bao (aka the "Chinese Burger" as indicated by our kind server) and the steamed Crab doused in hua diao wine and ginger.Kou Rou Bao was just stunning. The steamed buns came hot and fresh, while a separate plate held five slices of marinated braised pork belly. A a bit of a Do-it-yourself burger where you take a strip of pork belly put it inside a steam bun. If you'd like, you can also add a strip of lettuce to make it the more "healthy." :PAs for the steamed crab, it was nothing short of special. This is not just some crab you put in a steamer and that's it. Nope, these crabs have a sophisticated flavour that blends hua diao wine with the juices of the crab. Wow. While all the crabs in Singapore focus on Chili Crabs or Pepper Crabs, it was nice to try something different for a change.Overall, the food at Ubin Kitchen was fantastic! Food wise, I'm of the view that it's 4.5 stars, but have settled on 4 stars since the server did not inform us that we would have to wait 30 minutes for both dishes.

Hate to kick a guy when he's down. But this place clearly suffering the slow down in F&B in Singapore.  Place was empty. Ribs I'm sure we're good back in the day. But could tell they were frozen and cooked to order , not the usual tender fall off bone.  Staff attentive owner was gentleman. Sure if someone gave him cash infusion to bring standard back up it would be great spot.  Wish him well.

Great food + service. Too bad they didn't have the glutinous rice and crab when we were there, so we opted for the black pepper crab instead. Everything tastes great and the price was very reasonable compared to any seafood restaurants along ECP. The venue isn't big but they have several round tables to accommodate big groups. Would definitely come back again!

Here's where I've been eating since they first opened 4-5 years ago. They have now changed hands, but the perennial favourites here are the salted egg yolk squid and the fried bee hoon. These two have to be on the table every time I patronise . What I enjoy is the service here. Whether it is to eat in or take away, service crew is helpful and courteous. If I am waiting for my take away, they would offer me barley to drink while waiting. The prices are affordable and family friendly. Portions are generous. Usually with 5 dishes for 7 people, I would expect to pay $80+. They can be quite packed during the weekend nights, otherwise during lunch, they should have spaces for groups.If you are a true blue teochew or just a lover of fried prawn rolls, they do it really well here too!

It's been quite some time since I've eaten at a seafood restaurant, and my friends and I were glad to have the opportunity to take some time out of our busy schedule to give this highly acclaimed seafood restaurant a try.Usually, I eat either black pepper crab or chili crab when I dine in seafood restaurants, but we had heard good things about the steamed crab at this place and decided to give this a try. It turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. The steamed crab is cooked in hua diao wine and ginger. The flesh of the crabs was really sweet and juicy, and they had an excellent bite to them showing that the crabs were very healthy and fresh. This one is amazing.Another dish that we tried was the salted egg squids, and this one was really nice as well. Overall, you simply cannot go wrong with most of the dishes in this seafood restaurant. Two thumbs up from me.

Excellent food! The crab with glutinous rice is to die for. Don't miss the crispy pomfret fish too. Service is sincere and attentive, my only gripe is that the food takes a tad long to be served. But I guess that guarantees that everything is prepared fresh!

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-30/31 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: The Bottom Line: A decent Japanese restaurant to refuel at if you find yourself here.Try: Chicken and RicePro:The service was quick and the food almost as fast! The portions were fine, as was the food. It doesn't stand out, but it doesn't harm itself, either.Con:The biggest complaint I have is the soya milk drink I ordered... but that's entirely on me. I suspect it had barley and some sort of sweetener I wasn't used to, and it unfortunately colored my experience.

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-30/31 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: The food here are awesome delicious! Rice, miso soup and green tea (hot and cold) are free refill. The miso soup is especially delicious. Will definitely be back again for more. Friends and I have refill for more than 3 times. Hahaha! Singaporean. Five thumbs up for this restaurant!

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-30/31 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: This is a review of lunch at Ootoya Japanese Restaurant in Changi CIty Point Mall.This was more of a 3.5 star experience.The service was good throughout the meal.  Quickly seated, quickly fed.  The staff was friendly and professional.The room is clean with a simple design.The food makes it one of the better options for lunch in Changi CIty Point.There isn't anything over the top but the food is made from fresh ingredients and is well-prepared.I had the chicken cutlet over rice.  The rice was right on the mark.  The chicken cutlet was hot, crispy on the outside, and tender on the inside.  I have to say I really enjoyed this.  My only complaint was the portion left me hungry again within a couple of hours.tinyurl.com/9llw8fbThe meal also came with a very small starter of greens and mushrooms.  This was very fresh.  It was a good way to kick-off the meal.tinyurl.com/8le4o68If you are shopping in Changi or you work in the area, this is a nice option.  I will probably return.  The only reason I might not is that I am trying to work my way through all of the restaurants in Changi.

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-30/31 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: The food was passable and over priced for the offering.  The grilled chicken was good but did not make up for the rest of the average food. The menu was limited.

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-30/31 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: My friends and I were going for some fair at the Singapore Expo and decided to grab some quick chow @ Changi City Point. We loved japanese food and the first restaurant that caught our eye was this as we were too hungry to search for the mall directory. We had never tried the food at this restaurant before and was rather intrigue by its menu. They don't service the usual japanese fare. There are a lot of stewed and nabe (hot pot) in their menu. They also dish out food for the health conscious as you can choose the 5 grain rices and all. Great discovery and will definitely check out their other joints.

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-30/31 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: Dinner time. I gots lazy in my scroungy "only to be seen at home" clothes, and I was wondering how on earth to get some Japanese food in mah belleh. The always-brilliant Girlfriend chimes in with the voice of an angel with four magic words, "eh, call Ootoya lah." Did I mention she was always brilliant?It appears that she even acquired a copy of their takeaway menu on her last visit, and with that and a deft flick of her wrist (okay and a couple of follow up jabs to punch in a phone number), we were speaking to a jolly older lady who processed every last request we had.Cue a costume change to a "slightly more presentable for a neighbourhood trip" get-up, and in the car we went, coming round to the Changi City Point, and up to the restaurant.The cashier (also a jolly older lady) already had my food waiting (how fast did they make this stuff?!) and promptly showed me the bill. And even asked if I had a card from a particular bank - you get 15% off! Thankfully it was from one of the two banks I have accounts with (also one of the two cards I carry), and my wallet was very pleased with me. So was I.Back home and the food's on the table, and everyone's pleased. Its good food, from the grilled pork slices, to the curry katsudon, and with everyone and my saving balance appeased, I slipped back into some scroungy clothes to enjoy the rest of the evening. #nightwellspent

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-30/31 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: The blue fin tuna rice and the seaweed is superbly good and for the price of $16.90, it's really value for money... Top class!!!!I will encourage anyone who r fans of sashimi to try its blue fin tuna don...

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-30/31 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: Service was painfully slow, with the few staff on hand struggling to manage the queue of people waiting. One order was forgotten, and did not appear despite a number of reminders. A one for one drinks promotion was also forgotten - despite working in the area, we will absolutely not be returning.

Teh Tarik..Teh Tarik..Teh Tarik...I know Mr. Teh Tarik Eating House might not be the best place to have my favourite drink in Singapore, but I guess memories and the experiences made this cup the best I had in Singapore.From the friendly guy that happily posed a photo for me while he pulled my teaFrom the awesome street seating during rush hour watching all the traffic the sound of the city surrounding meFrom enjoying something that basic and tasty with my Yelp FriendFrom Yes the tea is GOOD...Thanks Mr. Teh Tarik for giving me a good memory of Singapore.....

Located across the road from Tampines Interchange and Tampines One, sitting at the Mr. Teh Tarik Eating House there is to me a portrayal of Singapore today. Sitting in the coffee shop, one feels immediately immersed in the life of the heartlands, with the friendly Indian uncle who greets you in Chinese or dialect and never fails to crack us up. However, any local would know that Mr. Teh Tarik is a chain store with outlets in many places, a representation of the capital progress of our nation. This particular outlet is my favourite though for the atmosphere - a real, old-school coffee shop that never fails to remind me of what Singapore is to me. The prata here is crispy and not bad, and of course, the teh tarik is good too. For those who like to hang around the area, it is an excellent place for supper when it is not so hot to be sitting outdoors. The prices are reasonable at a dollar for the teh tarik, so it is inexpensive too. For the friendly neighbourly feel that is quintessentially the Singapore I remember, I'd definitely be back for many times more in the future ahead.

comment: We had not been to Jumbo for 3 years due to Covid so was really looking forward to it. 8 of us arrived non reservation and were seated. We were IGNORED for 30 minutes then the drinks came in dribs and drabs and one did not get their drink despite constant requests the whole night. We were often brushed off with "coming coming". Then we ordered the set meal for 8 but they said we couldnt have it as "no big prawns" so we had to think all over again for a la cart which was only $80 less with less dishes and no doubt lowe value food. The fried rice was only egg no seafood for $ 26 and one small bowl each. The service continued to be inept and nonchalant, even rude. We didnt feel we were wanted there. Staff service more eager... attitude more ... authentic. Jumbo, go for East Coast branch

comment: Jumbo cooked crab and seafood. Had a great time with our group visiting from around the world. Service and food was excellent and I would recommend the peppered crab. Location has an outdoor patio and views of the ocean set in a semicircle park.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: I was surprised to find out that this restaurant chain is a public company listed in Singapore stock market. They must have perfected the process and quality of food across their restaurants.  The evening rush with full occupancy on all 2 floors (and outside seating area) showed that the customers appreciated it. The famous pepper and chili crabs lived up to their hypes. All other foods were fantastic. Every dish that we ordered was good. This is a must visit while in Singapore!The only complaint I had was lack of service after all the dishes were served. We basically were ignored. The final check came to about US$450 for 8 people - not cheap in Singapore standard but worth it.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Sticking with Singapore classics, you definitely need to visit Jumbo Seafood for amazing chilli crab!!!!!!! Jumbo serves delicious, flavourful Singapore seafood and other meat dishes!!! The chilli crab is a definite must try!!!!!! Although it may be a bit spicy, the flavours are extremely delicious and very unique!!!! For those who are allergic to peanuts though, the black pepper crab is just as flavourful and is an awesome replacement!!!! The crab is so succulent, tender and soaks up all the sauce!!!! Another must try is the mocha ribs and the drunken prawns!!!!!! The mocha ribs have a slightly sweet hint, but it works well with the moist tender pork meat!!!!! The drunken prawns are just as mouthwatering!!!!!! You may think that there will be a lot of alcohol flavour, but surprisingly there is only a slight alcohol taste and more chicken essence than anything!!!!! The prawns are also juicy and cooked to perfection!!!! They are infused with the delicious chicken and alcohol flavour!!!!! Other than the food, the restaurant has an outstanding view of the ocean and has excellent service!!!!! They are also very accommodating with food allergies and have managers ready to explain all the dishes or provide you with suggested dishes that can fit your specific diet!!!!! If you visit Singapore, Jumbo is a must try!!!!!!!!!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Thank you Julia Tran for a great meal. It was truly special.Julia took careful care of you of our kids that had allergy issues. She made his dishes first before all the others. Once she took the initiative order, she checked with the chef on the ingredients and to warn him to wash the woks before preparing these special dishes. I noticed she was wearing a hair net after talking with the chef. This made me think there is a high standard level of cleanliness in the kitchen.All the dishes we ordered were equally great. Plus she order exactly the correct amount so nothing was left for 14 people. We have no idea how much we ordered of each item so we're now anticipating the bill. What did we get?Chili and pepper crab. I preferred the black pepper both both were good.  I liked the vegetable dishes. The produce is very fresh. One was Chinese broccoli and scallops and the other dragon greens, mushrooms and garlic. Cereal shrimp (okay but others liked it), beef and onion, fried cod (cubed) and shrimp friend rice. Lastly the mini buns were light and the outside crust lightly crunchy. With about 5 sodas and 10% service, the total price was $750 for 14 or about $50 a person. The service was fantastic. It was definitely worth it.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Singapore is known for very good global (fusion) plates:  it's one of a few countries where everything works infrastructure-wise and everyone gets along i.e. 4 cultures coexist  (Indian, Chinese, Malay, Indonesian)....decently.    One of the famed dishes in this beautiful country is Singaporean Chilli (that's right, two Ls) Crab.  There are tomes which document the popularity of chilli crab so I was curious to sample this dish.  Jumbo Seafood is one of the best preparers of chilli crab.  We didn't have time to search out KEK Seafood, another source for good chilli crab so Jumbo had to do for this trip.  Location-wise there's a Jumbo Seafood in many parts of the city, so it is accessible.  I also saw a Jumbo in Icon Siam (Bangkok) so Jumbo is expanding too.  We ordered a crab (about $80 US, for 1) and while the crab was presented nicely and smelled awesome, I failed to appreciate this famous dish for the following reasons.  First, crabs are imported from Malaysia or Indonesia, I can't remember which country, and it's reflected in the price.  The chilli crab comes with a cloyingly sweet sauce with a hint of heat/spice--  I'm definitely not into sweet main courses.  It also came with deliciously, light and pillowy sweet (again) buns a.k.a man tou, to sop up the sauce.  It gave my palate a 80% sweet,  with a whisper of heat. Honestly, I was a bit disoriented.  Sweet is dessert for me, not a main course.  Maybe it was an off night, and more sugar was added than less.  Maybe I'm spoiled with phenom Indo-Vietnamese-Malaysian-Chinese-Cambodian-Lao-Korean-Thai chefs educating my palate in Los Angeles.  Maybe.  Willing to cut some slack here but if this dish should be soulfully sweet, then that was the last time I will have had the famous chilli crab.  I can't claim the crabmeat tasted sweet because it didn't (the creature traveled from another country).  Had it been caught in the nearest river or sea, it would have been sweet.   The other dishes we ordered were very good however:  prawns with golden salted egg, mee goreng Malay style, kang kong, fried rice.   Service was very good.Tip:  Jumbo Seafood is also a tourist destination, prices are high, even for Singapore.  I'd come to this location if you were to visit as it's on the water, if you like H20.  Check out the Yelpista pix.

comment: We came with a table of 10+9 for a big family dinner and the service was extremely slow. We came on a Sunday night for dinner. Dishes came out one by one and the table would be empty for a good 5-10 minute between dishes. This is not typically for a family style, Asian restaurant. The staff and kitchen usually time the dishes better so there's a continuous flow of food. Most of the food was cold when arrived, but very flavorful. The main dish was the black pepper crab and it was quite delicious. Very nice pepper taste that left your mouth tingling a bit with spice; would have tasted better if the dish was warmer. Overall, food is not bad. The reason for the 2 is due to the slow service and cold food. I hope this restaurant can staff up and be more efficient with the dining experience.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Chili crab it is!!! First time in Singapore and the hype is real about chili crab.  Went with a few colleagues and wanted to know what the fuss was.  The restaurant itself was full of people: locals, tourist, people celebrating, etc.  definitely a crowd.  Almost every dish we had was superb and full of flavor.  Ambiance was great and decent service.  It is pricey however.Could honestly just eat the bread dipped into the chili crab sauce all day!  The chili crab itself was very delicious and you can kind of understand why it's a must try!  Also got the prawns with cereal.  I was kind of unsure about this dish, but I am glad I ate it.  Very different but unique and taste great!  The golden Phoenix chicken!!! One of my favorites!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Came here on a Monday night due to a recommendation from a local friend and this place was packed! We didn't have a reservation but luckily were seated within 10 minutes. We ordered both the famous chili crabs as well as the black pepper crabs. They'll provide you with bibs which were an absolute must because the sauce can easily get everywhere.The sauce from the chili crab was perfectly seasoned! Rich and thick yet not too spicy. Tons of flavor imbued in every bite. I simply couldn't stop eating it. Then the black pepper crabs arrived and I started devouring those too, although I did find the kick of the pepper to be actually a tad bit stronger than the chili version.If you make it out here, you won't go wrong with either dish. But just to be safe, you should definitely order both!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: When in Singapore, you must try chilli crab - or atleast that's what any guide book seems to insist. Suppressing all scepticism, I took a visiting friend to Jumbo which is one of the four chilli crab Meccas here all lined conveniently next to each other along East Coast park. We got one chilli crab to share between two of us which cost around $62. No chilli crab is complete without deep fried buns to mop up the gravy and Jumbo's are just sheer perfection: crispy on the outside and warm and fluffy on the inside with just a slight sweetness to them. At this point, I need to throw up my hands and admit that YES Jumbo's serves some pretty damn good chilli crab. The gravy is delicious. Rich and thick, the best part is the sharp kick to it at the end. I was expecting it to be a lot spicier than it was but it had too much flavour packed into it to make up for it. The crab itself was juicy and tender. We struggled to get all the flesh out of the shell but it's worth prying out every little bit. The atmosphere is also incredibly relaxing especially if you snag an outside table right next to the ocean. The staff were all very prompt and efficient. We were the last ones to leave the restaurant but they made no motion to hurry us and even gave us a 10% discount at the end for no reason! My only gripe is the very small vegetarian selection which is somewhat understandable at a seafood restaurant. My mother got rice with vegetable stir fry which came in a tiny portion costing $18. Total rip off for a very average tasting dish.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Signature Chili Crab was a wondrous experience!Great service too and fast.  So many side items also hit the mark, superb Bamboo Clams, tender and succulent.  They were overshadowed by the crab which was MEGA FRESH and meaty.  Save the crab for last.  Pro-Tip.If you leave this place hungry you're doing it wrong.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Great location on waterfront. Make a reservation as it's a destination for many tourists and locals celebrating events.You have to try the chili crab and or black pepper crab. Huge, tasty and enough for 2-3 folks.If you speak mandarin, it helps. We had one person in group who did and made ordering and service better.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Make no mistake...this is a tourist trap. Back in the days before Jumbo Seafood IPO on the stock exchange, prices were more affordable & reasonable. Right now, expect exorbitant prices of the seafood dishes. I went there with the family (16 of us) and ordered steam prawns, chili crap, salted egg crap, sambal kang kong, fried baby squid, Chinese donut, fried mee goreng, hot plate tofu & desserts, with a jug of beer...total bill came to $877!!!  Unfortunately, this will be my last visit to Jumbo Seafood.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: A Singapore institution for seafood. Definitely get the Chili Crab. It's a giant crab served in a sweet spicy sauce. Also get the man tou (pan-fried bread) to dip in the crab sweet spicy sauce. Quality of the crab is excellent - sweet fresh crab that goes well with the sauce. The black pepper crab is not as good though so perhaps stick to the chili crab for Jumbo. The seafood is fresh in general - we also enjoyed the ginger and scallion prawn and steamed fish.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: On our last night in Singapore, my boyfriend's mother and sister took us to Jumbo Seafood where we had a beautiful waterfront view. Although I love crab, my boyfriend isn't a fan but we still decided to go because our new friends in Hong Kong raved about trying pepper and/or chili crab. We ordered:- Chili crab- Fried cod fish with spicy sauce- Scallops wrapped in yam ring- Broccoli with scallops- Steamed (white) buns and deep fried bunsThe chili crab was wonderful! The crab we received, a portion size for three people, was the largest crab I've ever seen!! Certainly fitting considering the name of the restaurant. I'm not usually a fan of filling up on bread, but it was difficult to resist dipping the steamed buns in the chili crab sauce. And.. this is was after I ate spoonfuls on top of my rice. So much flavor!The broccoli with scallops were fine, but the scallops wrapped in yam were even better! My boyfriend almost decided to get a second order of them. Finally, the fried cod fish was delicious! I would order that again as well. Our bill ended up around SGD 200-250.. If you're not opposed to taking a day trip to Malaysia (possible via bus, car or taxi), we were told you can get much more pepper or chili crab for much cheaper there! Regardless, I highly recommend you check this place out if you're in Singapore! Extra tips and FYIs:- There is no AC!- Make reservations if you want to avoid a long wait during certain days or times.- The menu has plenty of pictures and English to help guide your ordering.- Chili crab can be quite messy; I recommend using the disposable bibs they give out.- Don't be afraid to flag down any server you see if you need something!- If you have trouble breaking through the HUGE claws or other parts of the crab, you can put them on a plate and ask the server to have the kitchen break them for you! You don't want any going to waste :)

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: We visited Jumbo Seafood with a group of friends to finally try the famous chili crab. We also got black pepper crab, clams, and some veggies as well. The food was tasty and the bib provided was absolutely necessary! I was a mess! I actually liked the pepper crab more than the chili crab because it was too sweet for my tastes. The fresh coconut was the perfect choice to combat some of the spice!The setting of the restaurant next to the beach allowed for a nice breeze. The place is great for groups with large tables that featured turn tables that are ideal for family-style meals.It was approximately $80 per person, which was reasonable for the amount of crab we ordered. For the price, I expect a bit more upscale ambiance and more attentive service. My official rating would be 3.5 out of 5 stars. If we've got a large group of guests looking to enjoy the ocean and a Singaporean traditional meal, I'll likely take them here.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Chili crab with extra sauce with man tao and black pepper crab! So good :) I was quite surprised at the chili crab because I wasn't sure what to expect other than I hear Singaporeans chili crab is really good. And that it was, I found it to be the perfect balance of taste and spicy. It was quite good and the black pepper was a good flavor too. Definitely was a messier meal and expect to get your hands finger licking dirty with yummy sauce. The crab was fresh and good quality. The fresh prawns were also quite good and plump! And we had an 2 appetizers, one was scallops and taro while the second was a tofu dish. And a salted fish chicken fried rice.Service was not the best but fine, just had to wave them down for a little. Location is great because here is indoor covered outdoor seating and it's on the oceanfront so you can have a nice view as well as walk along the water before or after your meal. Would definitely return and bring guests that visit too Tip: reservations so you don't have to queue. But even if you do, it's not too bad if you go early Tip 2: bring some napkins and don't wear white in case you get it dirty when you use your hands for the crab

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: As many have already said, you must try chili crab in Singapore, and every time I'm here, this is the place I go.  It's a large crab, some of the pieces require a bit of patience to get the meat out, but wow is it delicious.  Get the fried rolls to dip into the sauce.  In fact, grab a spoon and just shove that delicious sauce into your mouth.  It's that good.I also tried the sambal shrimp, which was delicious as well with plump shrimp and little pieces of pineapple in it. Hotel called in a reservation and I was seated immediately.  Warning: It is messy!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Came here my last day in Singapore since I felt like chili crab is an obligated must eat. This place has a huge outdoor seating with quite minimum wait. Service was great as our server even helped us to crack the crab more.Onto the food, we got the more expensive Alaskan deep sea crab cuz there was a "promotion". The dish came like warm. This was not my first time eating chili crab in jumbo or no signboard and luke warm crab was not satisfying. The chili sauce was amazing as it seems like they put broken crab meat in it. Overall, I think jumbo or no signboard have both going downhill in terms of quality. Maybe next time chili crab should no longer be my must eat.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Thank you Julia Tran for a great meal. It was truly special.Julia took careful care of you of our kids that had allergy issues. She made his dishes first before all the others. Once she took the initiative order, she checked with the chef on the ingredients and to warn him to wash the woks before preparing these special dishes. I noticed she was wearing a hair net after talking with the chef. This made me think there is a high standard level of cleanliness in the kitchen.All the dishes we ordered were equally great. Plus she order exactly the correct amount so nothing was left for 14 people. We have no idea how much we ordered of each item so we're now anticipating the bill. What did we get?Chili and pepper crab. I preferred the black pepper both both were good.  I liked the vegetable dishes. The produce is very fresh. One was Chinese broccoli and scallops and the other dragon greens, mushrooms and garlic. Cereal shrimp (okay but others liked it), beef and onion, fried cod (cubed) and shrimp friend rice. Lastly the mini buns were light and the outside crust lightly crunchy. With about 5 sodas and 10% service, the total price was $750 for 14 or about $50 a person. The service was fantastic. It was definitely worth it.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Best of Singapore food, both black pepper and chili crab prawns too. 2 lb crab from Sri Lanka.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Gotta try the pepper crab..... I know everyone says chili crab but love the pepper crab. The noodles and 空心菜 is yum yum. A must try Singapore classic.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Never disappoints!  Excellent chili crab and even better pepper crab. Don't miss the deep fried baby octopus.Sit outside and enjoy the balmy weather and the pitchers of tiger beer. The food here is always a highlight.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Overrated.Chili crab was okay. Wasn't as fresh as the hype would've lead us to believe. Breaded scallops were elegant, mantou bread was nom-worthy, and the fried rice was great... and the service was quite decent.We had a reservation inside, and hence ate inside-- but I think outside is the better experience.We had some amazing food-- and from the popularity of the Jumbo chain, I assume they're capable of excellent food-- but for whatever reason, our experience was decidedly so-so as soon as the signature dish came out. We even made it a point to come to this specific location, as friends said this one was the best. Maybe they were wrong?

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Went back again this year and it was excellent again. Looking forward to the next visit!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: CHILI CRAB.  Enough said.There is nothing like this back in the states, so if you're visiting Singapore, I strongly recommend a visit to Jumbo Seafood.  Things to keep in mind when planning dinner here.  The wait time is LONGGGGGG.  Be sure to call for a reservation or show up really early to put your name down.  If you're at the waterfront, note that there are two restaurants within 10 minutes walking distance of each other.  I stopped by the busier location first at the end of the canal and was told the wait would be 3 hours long.  I found some wifi and noticed another location 10 minutes down the canal and walked that way to kill some time.  I had to walk under a bridge, but once I got to the other side, I found the other location which only had a 15 minute wait. Things to order:- Chili Crab (be aware that i'll cost you ~$50-60 USD per crab)- Pepper Crab - Garlic Ong choy veggies- Man tou (bread rolls, asian style)

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: This restaurant is very close to the airport, we all loved foods here especially crab and BBQ fish, reasonable price, but it's difficult to get a taxi in the night.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: After going to the Jumbo at Clarke Quay, and being blessed with an "extra" night in Singapore of course I would choose to have Jumbo as my last meal in this great food city.This location is right on the water similar to Clark Quay, but not the river. The ocean breeze that night was quite cool and a pleasant change to the heat of the day. We were seated right away, and requested to be seated outside so we could enjoy the weather (better than being in 20 degrees and snow in NJ). The food was great and just as I had remembered it from two nights before. This time, we went with the Black Pepper Crab and Chili Crab (again), but also tried the Salted Egg Prawns and the Tofu dish. Again, everything did not have a chance once it hit the table. Each nook and cranny of the crabs was cleaned up, combined with the fried buns and chili sauce. As it was my last night in Singapore, I thought it would be good to buy the mix to take back to the States to have a crack at making it myself one day.Startlingly impressive food; makes you eat beyond capacity.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: My cousin's family took us to this place, which seemed less touristy than clarke quay, but still massively crowded. If you're in the CBD I wouldn't travel all the way out here unless you wanted to check out the east coast park and beaches.First off, this place is outdoors and hot AF...and it's very close to the strait of Singapore, so it does have a nice ocean breeze.It's definitely pricey, like $50-60 per crab, but any crab that's damn near a kilo will be. Much different than the USA blue crabs or king/snow crab legs...they give you a bib for a reason.While I did enjoy the Chilli Crab, the Black Pepper Crab is even better. Apparently the ish is to get deep fried mantou (those white chinese bread things), which you can then dip in the sauce. A little too rich for me, I prefer rice! They ran out of razor clams :'( We also ordered cereal prawns and deep fried crispy squid; cereal prawns are unique, I wasn't a huge fan of the squid, it didn't taste bad or anything, just not my ish.4 stars only because it's very much like a factory and I felt like the waitrons were trying to constantly upsell with more food than needed, special order desserts (apparently they take a while), and threatening that if you don't order now it'll take an hour (???). That being said, there are a ton of diners, so it's somewhat plausible, I'm just not that used to it.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: This was my 2nd time in the same day eating at Jumbo. I first ate at the one in Clarke Quay, and then when the boss flew in he wanted to go to this one. We were seated quite quickly due to our reservation, and it was outside the restaurant closer to the water. I didn't really like our table because it was pretty close to where everybody goes to smoke so I occasionally had the odor of cigarette smoke while eating, but it wasn't too bad.The Chili crab and satays were very good, but the black pepper crab was too peppery.The cereal prawns had a lot of cereal but not too much prawn. The fish in banana leaf was decent. Overall it was pretty decent but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: The usual Singaporean-go-to spot for seafood. The east coast branch is by far the most popular on the island. I am guessing it's because of its complimentary location near the sea adds to one's seafood dining experience. It's super crowded on weekend evenings. Do not attempt to go without a booking, especially if it is a public holiday weekend. Overall, Jumbo doesn't disappoint. It serves quality seafood amidst a casual and family-friendly environment. Singaporean families (across generations - think aunty, uncle, cousins...) gather here for good seafood. Food: 1. Pepper crab - Awesome! Get your bibs ready! It can get messy. 2. Chili crab sauce & man tou - I LOVE their man tous (fried buns). It's fried to golden perfection! Crispy on the outside but soft & smooth on the inside. I could eat a plate of these (they are pretty small in size), especially dipped in chili sauce. TIP: you can order the chili crab sauce without having to order the whole crab itself. So you can have your crab in another sauce (black pepper) and still get to enjoy the wholesome goodness of dipping your man tous in the chili sauce. Double happiness. 3. Fried you tiao - LOVE! These are fried doughs stuffed with fish paste. It may sound strange to foreigners but they are heavenly. A must-try for sure. 4. Mee goreng - Good. A little spicy though. Be warned. 5. Mix vegetable & mushrooms - Good. The mushrooms were so fresh. 6. Steam prawns with egg - LOVE! The prawn was so fresh & sweet. It comes served with a sweet black sauce which goes so well with the prawns. I could eat this all day. Service: - Very efficient!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: First make a reservation. Avoid the lines. Still not a fan of the sneaky charging of peanuts, tea etc which I guess is a Singaporean thing. Anyway, the black pepper crab is very nice. I think the chili is better but nice to have alternatives. Regarding the venue, you can have a nice stroll on ecp afterwards. I suppose if you can get the outdoor seating, that would be more charming. Jumbo is a must visit if you are visiting Singapore.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: In my many trips to Singapore, I always stop into Jumbo just so I can indulge myself with the best they have to offer. What is the best you might ask? Well the chilli crab is one, the second is the pitcher of lime juice, and third is the fresh rolls that they offer. When you get the chilli crab and the rolls are in front of you, I got 3 words for you... dunk the rolls! Get those fresh hot buns covered in the chilli crab sauce and let it take you to cloud 9. You canalso requestfor them to giveyou bibswhich ishighly recommended as the seafood had a tendency to go flying around.  To top it off,  there are also outdoor seating available for you to enjoy the oceanfront via while eating during the day or harbor lights at night. Either way, it is a nice perk especially for you romantics out there!  Big props, I don't give out 5 stars to really but Jumbo has done something right here.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Amazing food! Cant go wrong with anything you order if you're not picky.  Service is fast but need some English language improvement.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: This place is so much better than No Sign Board. The chili crab was on point the flavor the sauce was not too sweet and not too spicy. I loved the crab was really fresh. The view isn't bad either. I will definitely be back when I'm in Singapore.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in the world (and I do mean the entire world).  When I lived in Singapore we came to the East Coast Jumbo regularly and always brought out of town guests. The one on the East Cost is the best (IMHO). There is nothing fancy about this restaurant.  Come to sit by the ocean on uncomfortable plastic chairs, enjoy some cold beer, and devour as many crabs as you can.  The awesome Jumbo experience is very simple and consists of only five elements, so anyone can execute this plan.  Here it is:1) Sit outside, not inside2) Order beer, and then keep ordering it throughout the meal (you'll see why shortly)3) Order lots of Chili Crabs4) Order a ton of Man-tou buns (fried, not steamed).5) After you are done with the first 4 things, order Sago for dessert (even if the waitstaff gives you a hard time about it).I believe Chili Crab may be one of nature's most perfect food substances.  The crab is huge, meaty, and sweet.  The sauce is beyond compare - rich, tangy, and oh so spicy.  And extra good when you sop it up with the Man-tou (kind of like little savory doughnuts).  Lot's of fried spicy goodness there.  Order double the number of buns they suggest - I seem to prefer a higher bun to sauce ratio then is standard.I see many reviewers indicate you should go with Black Pepper Crab.  While that is a fine dish, I've always preferred the sauciness of Chili Crab.  But try them both - you can't go wrong.  Also, remember to wear clothes that can get soiled.  Those crabs are messy, but that is half the fun.Finally, let me put in a word for Sago.  It's kind of like cold sweetened coconut soup with melon balls and ice shavings.  Delicious, refreshing, and the perfect antidote to your burning lips from the yummy Chili Crab.  My Father almost passed out from delight the first time he had Sago here.In short, when I next make the long, long, long trip from Chicago to Singapore I will be heading to Jumbo.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Gross. Disgusting. Icky. These are just some of the words you will be using to describe your eating experience at Jumbo. Not because of the food, no, no, but because of how messy you will get eating the delicious, drool inducing chili crab. This is some of the best stuff on earth. Seriously. If you come here for nothing else you will be quite happy. The crab is really fresh and the sauce is just so he right amount of spicy. It's very messy and finger lickin good. We also had the cereal prawn that was just a bit too sweet, it tastes very similar to coconut shrimp and also the yam covered scallops. They were also very good. You obviously have to have beer with your chili crab so make sure to grab a pitcher of tiger. This is the third or fourth time here from America, I will always come back here to eat. I love it so much. I'll be coming here for years to come. I wish they sold the chili sauce by the gallon. I would just drink it.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Went to Jumbo on my first trip to Singapore, and I am already trying to plan another vacation back out here just to get the Chili Crab! Came here with a large party for dinner and sat outside. It was really nice to sit along the water and the weather was just right- no jacket needed and it was cool nice breeze (good break from all the humidity!)Ordered and sampled a variety of things and was not disappointed in any thing!By far the chili crab was my favorite! Saw you could buy a mix to take home and make yourself but I didn't in fear it would not turn out the same. In California we have different types of crab so was almost positive it would not turn out the same :( It's also really good if you dip your bread into the chili sauce! The tangy, sweet, spicy and savory sauce it comes with is to diiiiiie for! Devastated theres nothing like this in the US!Pepper crab- delicious! Perfect blend of a spicy and sweetness of a crabBoiled live shrimp comes in a wine soup - get about 3 per person.Chicken/Beef kabobs- tastes good if you dip it in their peanut sauce!Malaysia dry noodle- reminded me to be similar to a spaghetti with seafood in it. Mango- not sure if its the right season or if its just always good- but the mango is soft and sweet! perfect way to end your meal.Ate a lot more- but can't remember the names. If I can remember the names I will update this review accordingly!Staff is great and attentive- always there to switch out your messy plates and bring more stuff to the table as needed. Free wifi for restaurant guests- on the table you will see the wifi name and password.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Not sure why this place is so highly recommended - it's bloody awful... probably the worst place we have ever eaten at.It is touristy, overpriced and actually not very good at all...  Singaporeans tell me it's just for the tourists and they do a lot of advertising to be well known...We actually felt sick after eating here - nothing was really fresh or healthy and it was just your typical chinese food covered in sticky, gooey sauce...Two of the dishes we ordered had pictures on the menu and they looked nothing like it when they arrived ;-)   The cod was certainly frozen and not fresh and the deep fried squid tasted of rotten fish.I know this sounds unbelievable for such a well known restaurant, but I can tell you the other English people sat close by to us were also not happy and arrived after us and left before us... so we were not alone in our thinking! Our taxi driver laughed when we told him we hated it and he told us we should have eaten at the Eastcoast Hawker Centre as it's better, more authentic and cheaper - I wish we'd known that before we spent a fortune here ;-)Definitely not a recommend!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: When in Singapore, you must partake in one of the island's most famous dishes: chilli crab. Tangy, a tad sweet, savory, and spicy, it hits all of your important taste buds and leaves you wanting more. It's messy, so get in there with your fingers and dig in, literally. Order some fried buns (mantou) to soak up some of that delicious chilli sauce, and you've got a fantastic meal. It gets pricey, but it's worth it. A few tips for those non-natives ( that I learned the hard way): there are no napkins. How you're expected to eat this crab with no provided napkins is beyond me, but that's how it's done in SG. Stop by a convenience store and pick up a multi-pack of tissues, since that's what everyone uses for napkins. The restaurant provides you with a finger bowl to rinse your hands while eating. If all else fails, watch the people around you and enjoy!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Made reservations online and got seated right away despite long line. Not sure if it's BC it was only two of us BC everyone in line had a reservation.We ordered the famous chili crab, both fried and steamed mantou bread, and the fried frog legs in onion or something, and the famous beer (way overpriced).Hubby loved the Chili crab, slurped every last but up. It  was too sweet for me. I wish I got the black pepper one instead. The bread helped get the sauce off.It was my first time having frog and i loved it! Would come back just for that!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Big, generous portions of fresh seafood is what you'll find here. We tried the iconic chilli crab - very messy but what a delicious mess! Ask for the cute little buns to mop up that killer sauce. The buns themselves are soft like pillows.The fried tilapia with mango salsa is really flavourful and doesn't feel too heavy despite being fried. Wash it all down with a Thai coconut.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Tried the black pepper crab and also the chili crab I love the flavor and wish I could get more! The only problem was I broke out in a semi rash mode, not sure why but without that happening this place is a MUST!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: If you could give 0 stars...After longing for a nice evening seaside in the nearby hawker center and finding out it's closed due the to spring cleaning (who would have known), we went to a well known seafood place with chili crab specialities. Place is clean with wipes and bowls to clean ones hands.A lady came to pour us some tea which we found out was not complementary after talking to her for 5 minutes, so we gallantly denied the tea.The main waiter came and took our order. We weren't sure how big the portions were so we asked for how much people the medium portion is meant. 4-6 he said, but we wanted to share by 2 so we took the 2-3. First our friend got his fried fish which came pretty late so we shared that. His side order would not arrive for the next 30 minutes.Our dish came and is meant for one person with a small stomach. Trying to find the waiter without success we got pretty angry but decided not to do anything about it. When the side dish came after 2 times asking again, we shared that as well. Maybe we should have ordered the 160Sin$ Lobster...maybe than we would have been treated like real customers.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Delicious food, cool sea breeze, semidarkness (it was close to midnight and our second or third dinner of the day) = a perfect Jumbo experience.  We ordered a Chili Crab and a prawn dish which I can no longer remember.  The crab  meat was succulent and sweet, drenched in a thick sauce that was tangy-spicy-sweet all at once.  I could eat that sauce by the spoonful, but better to sop it up with golden fried buns.Service was efficient and friendly.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Worth it for the Chili Crab alone, but a really cool experience overall.Wonderful views & breeze at dusk, plus non-stop service, rotating dishes of massive variety (if you order right) & all delivered with a relaxed & fun vibe even though the joint is pretty big & crowded.Disclaimer: Be prepared to get a bit messy.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Chili Crab. If you're visiting Singapore, you've probably been told that you _need_ to try it. Jumbo is one of the more famous chains which serve this Singaporean dish (the other is Longbeach).The chilli crab is a little sweet, a little spicy, and while the crab itself is good, it's the sauce that really stands out. Order a few of the fried mantou (buns) on the side, and get ready to soak up all that saucy goodness! (Trust me, you'll need more mantou than you think!)  For what you pay (about $55 a kg) it's pricey.  A crab will be anywhere between $50-80, and it's not a whole lot of food, but hey, when in Singapore...The cereal prawn ($20 or so) is also really good, make sure you order it with the shell off. Breaded in a slightly sweet and crunchy cereal breading, it's well worth a try.And don't be afraid of wearing the bib for the crab (ask for it if they don't offer), even the locals do it!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: One star for the food. The steam prawns over cooked. Moreover, steam prawns should come out first instead last. Very pricey! There was cockroach crawled on my wife leg. The seafood horfun was tasteless. When asked for feedback online, of course, we give feedback both online and verbal but they did nothing to win us back.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Came here for the pepper crab and chili crab. Just get the pepper crab; it's far superior to the chili crab.  Also, don't order the special menu for "8 people" or "6 people". It's very expensive, and they give you some weird stuff (for non-singaporeans) that are not very tasty. I would just order off the menu only.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Ordered the chili crab and black pepper crab and noodles and seafood soup plus a veggie dish and the beggars stew.    The food was all tasty but lacked in spice. The shrimp in the food was small.  The biggest problem was the service.  We did not get rice until we asked 3 times and never got the chili sauce or hot sauce we kept asking for.   The chili crab never came out until we were done with everything else on the table, by then way too late as it was obvious we were ready to leave and not too happy.  You would think at $75 per crab they would treat you with a little more respect!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: When I heard Jumbo Seafood, I wasn't all that excited to eat dinner there because I'm not a very big fan of seafood, but this place definitely changed my mind. I heard Singapore is known for their spicy crabs so of course we had to go somewhere really authentic to get it. This restaurant has a really nice bay view but it was raining that day so we couldn't sit outside to enjoy the scene. So the food. There was 13 of us and we ordered what seemed like everything on the menu so that we can try a little of everything. We got the spicy crab and the peppered crab which I guess for a non-seafood eater was pretty decent although I still wouldn't go out of my way to eat crab. My family really enjoyed it since they are seafood lovers. I do have to agree that it's probably the most flavorful crab I've ever tasted. To be honest, what I loved most about the meal was the little buns that came with the crabs. It really was just white dough with a little sugar but it was so soft and chewy and I think I probably had ten pieces all by myself. It was an overall good meal but because I don't really like seafood, I probably don't have the best judgment. One little boo boo was that they messed up our dessert and gave us a 13 people portion instead of a single serving like we asked and ended up just not giving us anything in the end after we waited for it foreverrrr. The service wasn't great but I guess we were a pretty loud annoying group with two babies that anyone would find hard to deal with.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Amazing chilli crab. The fried mantao are also a must if you get the chilli crab because they taste so great together! The service is not very attentive and you have to call a waiter if you need something since they don't check up on you but that's understandable since the restaurant is so packed. Make sure to make a reservation or you might have to wait a while!! Sitting outside when the sun is setting is great. The heat is combatted by the wind so you won't melt. If you want good lighting though, sit inside because the lighting after dark comes mostly from the large red sign that makes everything tinted red.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Chili crab was nice and spicy and pretty good.  Very expensive for what you get though. The cereal shrimp was yummy as well as the scallops with broccoli.  My favorite was the dried mini donut like breads that I used to sop up the chile crab sauce!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Ahhh East Coast Parkway.Ahhh Jumbo.Ahhh Chili Crab!Outdoor seating on patio tables and chairs.Large fans and a nice sea breeze to keep you cool while your mouth heats up.Popular place and it's easy to see why.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Looking for a late evening meal on a long layover in Singapore.  Hours posted are until midnight. Arrived at 11:10 after a $25 uber ride.  I was told they had taken their last order and was refused service, even though there were at least 30 customers still eating.  I own a restaurant and this is one of my pet peeves. We serve until 10 minutes after the posted closing time. If you want to close at 11 just post an 11 closing time.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: The last couple of times we were in Singapore, hubby and I went to Long Beach which is next door to Jumbo but we decided to try Jumbo this time because we wanted to wear the Jumbo bib! We also usually get chilli crab but decided to try the black pepper crab this time which was awesome and so was the bamboo clams and sambal kangkong! All this only cost us Sg$110 which is much less than what we would pay in Australia. Glad we came here! Just a tip, get here early or you'll be waiting a while before you get a table. Oh and don't expect good service...

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Chili crabs!! Black pepper crabs! My Singaporian friend said this was the best place to get them, and while I didn't try them anywhere else, I'll take her word for it -- they were delicious here. Get the mango drink and enjoy outside with a beautiful ocean view.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: The seafood was very jumbo as the name promised. A little too big in areas but I dealt. :) great place to go if you need a little aphrodisiacs in your life!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: If you travel to Singapore, this has to be a stop for you. Get the Chili Crab - we got three varieties. Its always crowded so be prepared, but they will serve you a beer while you wait. We chose to sit at a group table that seats about 10 people which was a great night. We sat with two other families and had a great time. Don't be shy and talk with your table mates. We had a great time talking with both families it was a great experience. The crab dishes are wonderful and full of flavor, well worth the price. We tried a variety of seafood appetizers and all were very good. We left stuffed. Plenty of wait staff on hand to take care of you.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Rumour has it that Jumbo serves the best black pepper crab in town and I've been there enough times to say that their black pepper crab has got mojo.The pepper sauce manages to seep into the meat and coat it enough so that you get a hit of peppery goodness with every mouthful of crab. There's other places that serve black pepper crab and you can only taste the pepper on the shell but more often than not, Jumbo gets it right.I wont jump the gun and say this is the best ever black pepper crab, only because I havent gone on a black pepper crab spree to find the ultimate one. I would say this is the benchmark.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: I rarely give 4 stars for restaurants. Jumbo has delicious food and a great atmosphere. We did not order any of their special crab on our last visit, but everything else was perfectly cooked and flavorful. Pretty good service too. A bit on the expensive side and not close to home so we will only go here every 6 months or so.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Jumbo didn't fail to deliver a yummy chilli crab famous in Singapore for a reason - deliciousness

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: The Chili Crab is an absolute must for crab lovers when visiting Singapore - it is one of the most delicious dishes you can possibly eat and possibly the messiest as you don't want to leave even a small morsel of crab behind.  The crab is perfectly seasoned in a garlic, ginger, chili sauce that complements the taste of crab - does not over power so the taste of crab comes through - there is so much of it, you'll want to have it over rice.  The cost justifies the quality of the dish.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Jumbo seafood is definitely a must see for tourists and locals.  The food is fresh, service is outstanding and we actually happen to be at the restaurant when Gordon Ramsey was visiting..  If he came to the restaurant it must be good!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: When we have out-of-town guests, we take them to Jumbos on East Coast or Red House at Robertson Quay if we are short on time.  Jumbos on the water is a fantastic experience getting the bibs and seeing the armada of ships vying for trade lanes.  Both the chili crab and pepper crab are consistently perfect tasting.  Even though Jumbos is always full, they've figured out a way to optimize the space so that the turnover happens at the same rate as people queuing up - so we've never had to wait for more than 5 minutes.  (To pass the time, check out the water skiing park next door if you have to wait...).   We have gone to Jumbos at Clarke Quay also, and it's great as well.  Atmosphere is just different - more yuppie/expat.  Very casual atmosphere and big round tables.  Bring your wet wipes, roll up your sleeves - and don't expect good lovin' tonight - as you will reek (in a good way) of garlic!

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: If you like to experience a new place through its food then Jumbo is a Singapore establishment you must try. There are six in the area but my favorite is the East Coast Seafood Centre location, mostly because its an excuse to get away from downtown, but all of them or good. You'll find the restaurant to be chaotic, crowded, and filled with locals and tourists alike. The food is served family style and is often messy, but very good. There is lots to choose from and while the staff speaks limited English it isn't hard to order. I recommend reservations as it can get very crowed. You're hotel concierge can help you out there. Seafood Centre is a 15-20 minutes cab ride from downtown. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu but the The Black Pepper or Chili Crab are must try items.

address: Blk 1206 East Coast Parkway #01-07/08 East Coast Seafood Centre Singapore 449883 Singapore
comment: Love this place!!! Ok so I haven't had Chili Crab everywhere, but this place is the best!!!

address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 65 Airport Boulevard #03-30/31 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: The place was packed during Sunday dinner time and we waited quite awhile for a table. The place was noisy and quite difficult to get the attention of the staffs. Condiments such as soyu, wasabi and sushi ginger were available on the table. Warm water was served and refillable but not for iced water.Miso Soup with Clam ($3.20++)The soup was a bit sandy, most properly sand from the sands. The meat in the clams was a bit smallish.Eel & Scrambled Egg Roll with Unagi Sauce ($8.90++)The maki roll was a bit dry which could do with a bit more of sauce.Roasted Sushi with Katsuo Inari ($4++)The sushi was not bad with no wasabi in it.Soba in Soup with Tempura ($12++)Was served with the udon version at first, and we told the staff that it was wrong order. Waited quite awhile for the replacement. It was not served with tempura sauce, nor did the soup base tasted like tempura sauce. The soba was not bad which the little one did ate quite an amount. The tempura consisted of 2 pieces of prawns, 1 piece of eggplant, and 1 piece of sweet potato. Pork Chop with Scrambled Egg & Rice ($12.80++)This dish took the longest time to arrive, even after we had finished the soba. The meat was a bit tough.

address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 65 Airport Boulevard #03-30/31 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: We were early for our flight and couldn't check in and go through security.... Stuck on the outside, we couldn't access the famed food court.We looked around and ended up at Itachi Sushi. They are in Terminal 3, on the 3rd floor, out of the main floor hustle and bustle of the check in counters. The venue was clean, relaxing and modern. The staff were friendly, accomadating and spoke ok English. The line of sushi chefs wore gloves and mouth guards. They cranked out an endless line of sushi and other items. We ordered a variety of dishes and they were all very tasty. The portions were on the small side, but the prices were reasonable (s$2-9) on most things, so we were able to have a wider variety of items.We loved that besides soy sauce, each table had a supply of wasabi and pickled ginger.

address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 65 Airport Boulevard #03-30/31 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: Hungry while waiting for my flight so we decided to check this place out since we missed our chance at the malls.The portions are ok for sushi and sashimi except for the fatty tuna handrolls where I could use a bit more tuna to rice ratio. Service was friendly and our orders were served  very fast, maybe that's how they turn tables quickly.Decent quality, priced higher than your regular sushi joint understandably because of their prime airport location.

address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 65 Airport Boulevard #03-30/31 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: I should've stuck with the sushi.One would think that if you ordered the tempura udon off the lunch menu that it wouldn't be so much to ask for. Unfortunately I had one of those situations where the 3 tables that arrived after me got their food before I did. And I was starving.To echo the other reviews, service is not really here. I was there before the lunch rush, and even then the server taking orders clearly wanted to be elsewhere.If you come here, stick with the sushi, or better yet, just go to Paradise Dynasty nearby- they're pretty consistent and at least the servers there have a soul.

address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 65 Airport Boulevard #03-30/31 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: Sushi was okay.  Nothing spectacular.  Grilled chicken came out cold.  It had been sitting a while.  Yep, probably just another typical airport restaurant.  Suggest going elsewhere.

address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 65 Airport Boulevard #03-30/31 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: If I desperately need my fix of amazing sushi, I head to this branch of Itacho because its nearer that heading to town for me. It can be a little quieter than the branches at ION or Plaza Singapura but it all depends on your luck. Sometimes there's a snaking queue outside the restaurant (which is basically the norm for most Itacho outlets).Nevertheless, this outlet is more spacious and I dont feel so crammed up when I'm there.As always, they serve killer sushi, with each one leaving you wanting more. I'm seriously just torturing myself writing about Itacho.Oh and I usually get a serving of Aji sashimi. Get them to deep fry the bones after youre done ;)

address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 65 Airport Boulevard #03-30/31 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: In the debate for quality against quantity, I feel like this place began with good intentions... and then didn't quite live up to them.I heard such great things about this chain, and have been wanting to visit for ages, then when I discovered a branch at the airport, I knew I had no excuse. Fast forward a couple of months for the hype to die down, I finally made some time to go, and wow. Hype rarely does businesses much favour. They were running a promo on hamachi, and there were little posters with lots of different ways you could have it, but duuuuuude. Why so many things out of stock? Your promo too popular ah?We finally settled on a couple of more regular items, but to my surprise, the nigiri options arrived by their lonesomes - I didn't know that they came in singles! Most places serve pairs, so I guess that's what I was expecting. The quality's pretty decent though, so I guess while it was good food, it went too quickly!Keep an eye out for these guys, I'm sure they'll do more good stuff, but I guess I'll keep in expectations in check next time.

address: Changi Airport Terminal 3 65 Airport Boulevard #03-30/31 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: Move aside Sushi Tei, Itacho is in town!Itacho serves us good quality sushi at a very reasonable price. Obviously, you will not get 1st class quality here. It is 2 levels below the Shinjis and a level below the Akashis.But Itacho is a place you can go everyday, without burning a hole in your pocket if you so desire to eat the premium stuff. For the price they are charging, the quality is very respectable. I like this place so much, that everytime I had to send someone to the airport, I always make a pit stop to Itacho first.A minus star for 1 bad incident that I have though. I came about 5 minutes before last order time but I was turned away from a table. But I don't hold grudges, I still come back to this place whenever I can.

pretting awayi don't know what i'm to sayi'll say it anywaytoday's another day to find youshying away(at the airport?)i'll be coming for your love, OK?take on me (pret a manger),take me on (pret a manger)i'll be gonein a day or two(but i'll be back, so make sure you are still around unlike your previous super short stint in sg!)so needless to sayi'm odds and endsbut I'm me pretting awayslowly learning that expensive is OK.say after me,"it's much better to have pret than be sorry."take on me (pret a manger),take me on (pret a manger)i'll be gonein a day or two(but i'll be back for your flat white and wild crayfish & rocket sandwich or wild crayfish & avocado salad!)oh, the prices i pay, yeah--is it life just to spend my money away?you're all the things I've got to remember(since my first trip to london and getting acquainted with you!)you're shying away(luckily i'm at the airport quite a bit!)i'll be coming for you anywaytake on me (pret a manger),take me on (pret a manger)i'll be gonein a day (but hope you won't)take on me (pret a manger),take me on (pret a manger)i'll be gonein a day (but hope you won't)

My favorite cold sandwich is always from Pret A Manger. Today I had the ham and cheese sandwich. They're using old Swiss cheese (I'm guessing) and leg ham (guessing again!) and it's so good!!!! Can't describe it enough. Just delicious!

While my friend was doing aggressive shopping at the shops at the airport, I was a little hungry and spotted Pret a Manger-one of my favorite venues. I looked over the selections and they had a crayfish and rocket sandwich with mayo on multigrain bread which I had never seen either in New York or in London. This was a must taste sensation. I bought my sandwich-Jenny was the counter person and very polite and efficient. The sandwich was delicious with no lack of crayfish in that sandwich. It was reasonably priced and I would recommend and return when in Singapore again.
This is a place awesome... coffee amazing and service impeccable.. if your ever in the Beautiful Singapore Airport I come have a cup

Glad to have one of my favourite places to eat has arrived in Singapore. Prices are okay and the food quality is up to standard. Unfortunately it has one of the worst, if not the worst, service I have ever had in my entire life. The gay server was very rude.
my go to place in Changi Airport.great sandwiches that beats the blue from sitting in a tiny economic seat with airline food.fresh ingredients and good buns, the cookies a d coffee are also good

I don't eat a lot of prawn noodle, but after trying this stall I'm reluctant to try anyone else.* Though some might find this a bit pricy ($8 for a regular size, and at most, $13 for a large size bowl with big prawns) the quality is there. I don't exactly know what goes in the broth, but it's not very watery. Rather, it has a good mix of prawn, pork, and garlic flavour. My favourite part is the bits of pork crackling that's thrown in. They are the juiciest, fattiest pieces and really make the dish. I like how you can throw in some chili/vinegar to cut through the heavy flavours.One of my favourite outdoor stalls in SG!--*But feel free to trick me by saying "Let's grab some chendol" and then take me to your fave prawn noodle spot, plop a bowl in front of me, and demand that I eat it and like it OR ELSE.

It's a total rip of for a bowl of $8 prawn noodle in Singapore with three mini shrimps and two think slick of pork . Taste is mediocre and forgettable , you can taste better one in blanco court prawn noodle in Beach road  or the nearby prawn noodle place in Still road where $8 can give you jumbo prawn . Totally not worth to come here . Save yourself the money and time.

Da Dong was sold out before 12.30 p.m. the last 2 Saturdays. Today they have prawns but no pork ribs. Soup is a bit too sweet.Verdict: Nice but not great. River South (Hoe Nam) Prawns Noodles tastes better to me.

My go to prawn mee store is closed for three weeks for the lunar new year, so I have to look for another shop to feed my craving for prawn mee with large prawns. Glad I took a chance to had breakfast here. The broth is very good (not as good as my usual go to shop), second best. Another plus is the fresh made crispy pork lard bits. I asked for extra and was given more than I expected. Service was good too.
