My sister and I only ordered one bowl as we just wanted to taste if it is good, as we had already had some breakfast at another shop down the street. The gentleman gave us two empty bowls so that we could split the food.Definitely will come back for more.

At 10am on a Sat, they are already fairly busy but the wait is not bad (10mins). As always their soup is excellent. We had the dry noodles and it came with some sambal premixed in the sauce. A little too spicy for kids but not so for anyone who is used to spicy food. Large portion can easily be eaten by hungry adult. Like that the shrimp are peeled and halved but not deveined.

This place has pretty darn good prawn noodles. The thing is, even though you order a large, you might end up ordering 3 bowls in total. A large isn't really a large. More like a small. Makes you wonder how big a regular size is. It's 10 dollars per bowl so it isn't really cheap compared to other hawker-like places.

Ahh, Prawn Noodles! A simple, yet beautiful dish. Located on the corner of Joo Chiat Road and Marshall Lane, Da Dong Prawn Noodles delivers one of the Best Prawn Noodles in the area, if not on the entire isling. Assessing the quality and taste of Prawn Noodles is often quite difficult. Frankly, they all have that shrimpy taste with a cooked garlic finish. In my opinion, what separates a so so prawn noodls from a fantastic one is: (i) the flavour, (ii) quality of the broth and (iii) the freshness of the prawn.Da Dong Prawn delivers all of these and more. The broth is rich in flavour and explodes in your mouth. The uncle even makes it an emphasis (a sign) that he doesn't re-fill the soup as it would dilute the flavours. Wow, that's quality. Overall, simply a fantastic prawn noodles. It is a little on the pricier side for prawn noodles, but hey, prawn noodles are a cheap comfort food anyways. :D

Arrived here at 08:45 hours . I ordered the Regular Size prawn noodles(5 sing). The aroma of prawns filled the air . One sip of this soup and WOWZERRRR's !!!!!!  The prawn broth was soooo intense . Mix in some chili's and.......WooooHooooo, a mouth full of fireworks. Yes , it's that good. The slow braised pork ribs gave the broth its savoriness . Such a simple, but amazing dish. The regular size leaves you craving for more, but in Singapore ; there's more phenomenal foods to try. Thank you Mr. Prawn Noodle Master

I stumbled across Mellvin Coffee Shop and found that everyone was having prawn noodles. I took this as a sign that the prawn noodles must be good, so we decided to give it a try. And indeed, I think this ranks among the best prawn mee that I have had. The soup is full of flavour. The prawns were fresh and juicy. The pork slices were cooked just right.Unfortunately, I came late on a Thursday afternoon around 1.30pm and he was out of pork ribs, so it was just regular prawn mee.A small bowl is $5, a regular bowl is $8, and a large bowl is $10.We had a regular bowl of prawn mee, and although I appreciate the extra soup, I think we could have gone for the small bowl instead.He also sells prawn noodles with large prawns. They cost slightly more at $9 for a regular sized bowl.

Uncle Ah Hoi is perhaps the most dedicated specialist whose hawker fare is not the least diluted by the crowd flocking over to his stall. Previously at Farrer, he told me that he only serves what's the best, and on my first visit, recommended I have a bowl of prawn mee soup. Carpark is readily available across the coffeeshop or along the road so as I shifted my car to a proper lot, uncle prepared a bowl and then urged me to eat it quick and not worry about paying first. The first sip of the soup, I was sold and in love. The sweetness of the prawn broth with the savouriness of garlic in it makes it simple and addictive. He gives 3 pieces of prawn and slices of lean pork meat along with a regular bowl, and nothing to complain. The sign at his stall states that he cannot top up soup because it will compromise the flavour if he did that. I found it bizarre that such after such a big bowl, anyone would want more, but when I was down to my last sip, I knew I was tempted to ask for more. Priced really fairly at $5 a bowl, I am glad for the natural tasting soup, made with love from the way uncle speaks of his food.He closes on Tuesdays, but otherwise, drop by before 2pm and you should be lucky enough to get a bowl!

This is "confirmed" to be the best prawn noodles you can get in Singapore (my humble opinion of course). The soup is amazingly fragrant and prawns they throw in is generous i.e. big and fresh. A bit pricey but worth every cent. I always go for the big pork rib at $10. Do go early on weekends because he always sells out by 1pm.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: I toured all three terminals surveying my food options before finding Sushi Burrito. As soon as I saw it, I had to have it. I'm obsessed with Sushirrito in the Bay Area and always order a sushi burrito when it's available. I was excited at first to see they had very similar rolls like Salmon Samba and Geishas Kiss, though under different names. I should have been deterred by the first reviewer, but I did not heed those wise words, and my excitement diminished when I realized they wouldn't make me a fresh sushi burrito. All the rolls are displayed as halves, so I thought maybe if I ordered a full roll they'd make me new one (nope, just two halves). And of course, it tasted like it's been sitting around for a while. Sushirrito tells you it's best enjoyed immediately, and I think that's true with any sushi burrito. Moist seaweed just doesn't stay good for long. Overall, not terrible, but not worth it.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: Meh. The sushi burrito is alright. I've had better and would not recommend this. They have a display of their various sushi burrito options on the window for you to choose from. You can either get a half burrito or full burrito. The rice was bland and the veggies tasted old (not fresh). I  got the rainbow shrimp burrito, which consisted of prawn tempura. However the prawn tempura was mushy and soft on the outside. You can tell that the burrito had been sitting out for a while and not fresh. FYI: It's located at the Changi Airport in the Terminal 1 departure gate near gate C.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: This place have fancy looking menu and vibrant colored sushi burritos staring at you through the glass display casing. That is about it. If you want sushi, go get a sushi. If you want a burrito, sorry, you need to get this before coming to the airport. Sushi burrito is basically like an uncut sushi roll with more ingredients. While that can sound attractive because hei, who doesn't like sushi?, but Sushi Burrito did it completely all wrong. I tried their unagi sushi burrito. The amount of unagi is like the amount you would get on 4 pieces of unagi sushi while the rice and fillers would make maybe 4 sets of sushi roll (4 x 6/8 of your regular sushi!). What are the fillers? Cucumbers, pickled veggies, onions and LOTS of rice. If I want my veggies, I would go get myself a bowl of salad. Lots of veggies maybe good for you but I paid to get a meal where I can taste unagi in most of my bites. Nope. It was mostly rice and veggies. For the price, I would not recommend this place. On the good side, their packaging is very handy for a quick grab and it is a healthy option.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: Was very excited to try out a local sushiritto concept. But the burrito did not meet my expectations. Was at the branch early in the morning (7am) before my flight and ordered the soft shell crab burrito. The crab was little and hard. Ratio of veggies to meat was 90:10. Could definitely use more meat at this price.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: I have been wanting to try out Sushi Burrito since I am a huge fan of Sushiritto in San Francisco. But i wont compare them because they are different although they have similar appearance.I was a bit skeptical since I heard a lot of my friends that Sushi Burrito is just so-so.  The first bite, I tried to compare it with what I had in SF. But i began to remove those thought as soon as I had my second bite. They are different. It taste so good and still fresh although i doubt it when i arrive at the stall and looking at those sushiburrito that already displayed. They just took those premade sushi and served it. Although it is still good, i wish they can make it fresh. Idk how it works for people who order half size. Maybe they will make the fresh version of that? Perhaps. So i just want to conclude my review that Sushi Burrito is a better version of handroll sushi that i usually have. It taste better than normal sushi or hand roll. It has good appearance. But perhaps, maybe more experimental flavor/sauce in the future. Note: the wasabi burned me

address: Pasir Ris Park 133 Pasir Ris Road, Pasir Ris Park, Carpark E Singapore 519149 Singapore
comment: Nice view, nice food and great service. A little rowdy with smoking teenagers on Friday night's though, other than that, all is great!

Having dined in muji cafe in the yuracho location in Tokyo, this one is totally different......The cake was so so and a bit dry.... I would not come again.  The selection is quite limited too .....I guess so too, why the hell I come to Singapore and try to eat Japanese food???  :(

Their frog leg soup is a must order! Very herbal-y. Just wished they boiled their red dates longer in the soup as it was too hard and kinda inedible. The flavour of the red dates doesn't absorb into the soup then whats the point?Anyways I made feedback a few times on their super wet chopsticks. Nothing was done. Other than that still a great place to dine at.
Not the best but not too bad. Price is affordable. Great place for family with kids. 五香quite okSesame chicken okVegetables ok

This is my 4th stop of the day on 17th Jan 2015.Was introduced to this place by Melissa Y. It is not too far from the Kembangan MRT and you could probably see the signboard from afar.Came here as Mel had purchased 2 Sugar coupons for the waffles and we decided to try the waffles with Hokkaido Milk & Honey and Figs . We also ordered the B.F.F. 4 types of fries and four types of sauces. The waffle was over-crispy but the ice creams were delicious. It was melting on the tongue after putting it in your mouth. Didn't really like the waffle that much as this time round it was over-cooked.The B.F.F. was interesting mix of fries. I like the truffle fries as it was crunchy but it doesn't have much truffle flavor on it. The wedges and the criss-cut fries were al-right (probably cause I've been eating too much other stuffs before coming here). I didn't try the shoestring fries (Curly fries?). The dips I have no clue what they are besides the tartar sauce.This place is rather cosy and inviting. On the walls it has writings and interesting quotes. Was not as crowded as I thought it maybe especially on a Saturday evening. Definitely a good place to hang out or even board game sessions :)

Located along Changi road is Rice & Fries. From what I understand it has opened for over a year now and I have just learnt about this place via the SUGAR app. It is within walking distance of Kembangan MRT. We managed to easily find a parallel parking street parking spot along Changi Road.1. Rack o' Ribs ($22.80)The great BBQ aroma from this dish would make anyone hungry! It was slighly charred to perfection and the meat fell off the bone. For Singapore standards it's pretty good, still nowhere near what I used to eat daily in the States. For $22.80 it's not too pricey, although that's as much as I would ever pay for ribs in Singapore.The meat was juicy and tender. The ribs were well executed with the barbecue sauce over nicely done meat.2. Waffles with Ice Cream ($5.80 each)With the SUGAR app, we managed to buy each waffle with ice cream for about $2 each! But nonetheless even at $5.80 It's still quite reasonable, compared to some cafes that charge like $9 for a whole waffle and ice cream. This is indeed only half a waffle but there's so much to love about this waffle.The waffle is delightfully crispy! It is not the fluffy kind, some online reviewers have mentioned that it tastes like over-cooked waffles or even "burnt". But to me, it was nice and crispy and I like it this way. The chocolate ice cream was a bit bitter, the green tea ice cream was nice and had the legit green tea taste in there. The salted caramel was the sweet ice cream amongst the 3 flavours. The waffle was slightly salty, some of my friends didn't like it so salty, but I felt that it was a good compliment for the salted caramel ice cream, since the ice cream was so sweet. Waffles and ice cream! Who can resist such a great combination of colours and flavours.The food at Rice & Fries may not be super awesome , it's nevertheless tasty and the ambience is very enjoyable. We were the only customers there on a saturday afternoon at 3pm.

What I like about this place is; it cover almost everything from western food to alcohol, coffee and tea and including ice cream with waffles. A very nice place to chill out. Surprised is not crowded even during weekend.Why 3 star is because though food is trendy but not really fantastic delicious, however is good enough.

Hungry after an errand at Orbea, the bike shop, I decided to give Rice and Fries a try. I wanted something light but couldn't resist the spicy prawn aglio olio. I enjoyed the huge prawns, the pasta slightly above mediocre. Not overly impressed but would give it another shot if I needed food and AC at 4pm again.
Must try their lamb shank. Very delicious and roasted with long hours. A good place to chill out with friends as well.

address: 121 Meyer Rd #01-07, The Makena Condo Singapore 437932 Singapore
comment: This is primarily a pizza place, and being a pizza lover, I had to come to this place because I have heard so many good things about the pizza here. I had some difficulty trying to locate this place because it was located in a somewhat hidden place. One of the pizzas that we had was the seafood pizza, which I found to be really delicious! The taste was very savory and the crust was thin and crispy. I personally like the crust to be thin, and pizzas with crusts that are overly thick and floury turn me off.We also had a few other pizzas such as the triple meat pizza and the pepperoni pizza, which were all good but no doubt, the pizza to try here is the seafood pizza. If you want, you could add on a little chili padi for that extra kick.All in all, highly recommended for a pizza joint that arguably beats the mainstream Pizza Hut.

This place serves old school no-frills char siew (seasoned barbecued pork), roast chicken, roast duck and sio bak (roast pork). The charred fatty cuts of meat are pretty much amazing, and I'm partial to the roast pork and roast chicken. It's also reasonably priced, at around S$4-6 for a packet of chicken rice. Ask for the dark meat (chicken thigh) instead of the leaner cuts. Trust me, it's worth the calories.The stall is located within the coffeeshop named "Keng Bee Restaurant" at the corner of the building facing the Caltex gas station. Seating within the coffeeshop is limited and there's parking at the back. The line is out the door pretty much at lunchtime, so do come early before they sell out.Depending on how long the line is, the guy at the stall might get a little grouchy or impatient with you. I also have to knock them for a less than stellar chilli sauce which is practically watered down beyond recognition.The stall is closed on Tuesdays, and a different hawker helms the evening shift at the same stall, so be aware that the food served might be different at dinner.TLDR; Old school roast chicken and roast pork with charred fatty cuts, reasonably priced but a bad attitude with a long wait. Good, cheap, fast, well you can only pick two!

This place is seriously underrated. Their charsiew and sio bak are damn awesome and are right up there with the big boys. I only say this as they aren't your usual household name when it comes to roast meats but hey definitely should be!The charsiew has a good balance of caramelised fat and meat. He gives me 2 kinds of charsiew. One more lean and another with the more caramelised note. The internationally charred bits of skin of the charsiew actually held a crunch.The sio bak is by far the BEST I've had in singapore. I dare put my name on the line for this one. The crackling, meat and fat are just crispy HEAVEN in your mouth. Out of all of Singapore... none can match the price and quality of this stall. It's mad.4.9/5 STARS

I'm going to cry, this place is SOOOO good. The name Nan Xiang Chicken Rice is misleading because this stall specializes in Roast Pork and Roast Duck.Let me start and end with the Roast Pork. WOW, I mean wow! It's got three layers of heaven: (i) juicy inside, (ii) marbled fatty area  and (iii) a crunchy skin. However, what separates this Char Siew vs. others is that the skin has got a serious Smokey Finish. The best part of all, the smokey flavour sticks in your mouth up until you eventually brush your teeth! :D   Be sure to bring your mints, if you plan to go out on a date afterwards. Word of Advice: To best enjoy the roast pork, DO NOT put any sauce on top. It will dilute the flavor. However, be sure to ask the uncle to put sauce on top of the rice. The separation of rice with sauce and the roast pork is just a perfect complement.  Lines are obviously long, Locals already know this little secret. The Uncle is as cool as cucumber and has this air of confidence that "yeah, i'm the man and what I'm serving you is the da bomb diggity!"    Badda bing Badda boom and there you have it. The best Roast Pork on the Red Dot bar none!
Sadly standard have dropped but the attitude the same - bad.  Condiments ginger water chilli water :)

This place is really a heaven-sent for meat lovers! Their char siew just feels so thick and the bite is just right. Not too dry, not too wet but juicy enough to wake up your senses of indulgence. The roasted pork is also made just fine, so fine. The crispy part and the fatty part and the meaty part just work out so well in your mouth. Unbelievable and indescribable.I didn't get to try the chicken and duck but I heard they are most famous for their duck. Just by trying the two meats above already lets them deserve the highest rating. I look forward to trying their duck and update this review but what a splendid meal of meat over here! Come on all carnivores, over here!

I was hungry, and running late for a meeting in the area, so I thought I'd stop here for a quick lunch... And my decision was made easier by the fact that there wasn't anything in the coffee shop to eat at 2pm, save the very last bits of char siew, siew yoke and some chicken breast... So I got a plate of char siew + siew yoke rice, and sat down to wolf it down.Fate intervened of course, and uncle had generously slapped on my plate some rough cut meats, liberally marbled with soft, juicy fat. As I took a second to admire his handiwork before shovelling it into my now ravenous mouth-hole, I realised the beauty in what lay before me - the rough cut meant he did not stinge on razor-thin slivers, and the chunkier segments offered more bite and flavour, so I could really experience the char in his char siew.Though I did savour each tasty morsel, it was gone too soon, and all I had left was the simple soup to end what was a very tasty meal for just three dollars. Who'd thought you could find such a gem?

This is a review of a lunch with a colleague at Nan Xiang Chicken Rice.tinyurl.com/cfer3ssWe were planning on going to a different spot.  But when we arrived, we changed our mind.  My colleague knew of Nan Xiang Chicken Rice and suggested we go there.The staff was terse but professional.The space is neat and clean enough.  It certainly will not send anyone running.tinyurl.com/d7hsfnoNan Xiang is reallyabout the food.  In that, they deliver.  Boy, do they deliver!Chicken rice with roast pork and char siew - This was a very tasty plate of food.  It was all good. The chicken, the roast pork, the char siew - mmm mmm good.  The rice was perfectly prepared.  The chicken was so tender.  Then you get the saltiness of the pork.  Needless to say, we left nothing on the plate.tinyurl.com/cvlw6qvI did not pay for this meal.  Great food, free food - You can't beat that.  The lime juice from the nearby stall was quite good and quite large.tinyurl.com/d53kzcoOverall - If you just want some really good chicken rice with some pork, then this is the place.  It is worth a little trip to visit.

I tapaoed this home and ate it three hours later for supper.The roast pork/charsiew tastes good even when cold. There's like three layers though not to be confused with the three-layered pork (San chen rou) which has a middle layer of pure fats.This charsiew is awesome and it's almost an art to see the stall owner finely slice the meat in front of you, then drizzle it with some sauce and pack it up for you.Now I know why the reviews of this place is so positive. Tried the chicken rice like 5 years ago, but kinda forgot how it tastes. Will come back again for chicken rice add charsiew/roast pork!

One of the best roast chicken in Singapore - not dry but juicy. I love the roast pork as well - it is crisp and marbled with enough fat.I usually order the chicken and the roast pork but even the char siew is good but there is only this much space in my stomach :)

address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 2 #01-21 Tampines, Singapore Singapore
comment: The atmosphere at Mikawa is delightful.  The peaceful ambiance, stone accents and clean, crispness provide a comfort that I've rarely seen duplicated at other overseas Japanese establishments.Service was prompt and attentive but not overly so.The sushi was fine, though a little heavy on the fish eggs for my tastes; even the California roll featured them.  The taste was just a little off, though not bad in any way.  While Mikawa was a nice enough restaurant, I don't know that it is somewhere I would necessarily recommend to a visitor.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 2 #01-21 Tampines, Singapore Singapore
comment: This Japanese restuarant had been around for one year and this is the first time we discover it. It served a wide range of Japanese food like Sashimi, sushi, maki mono, agemono, teppanyaki, yakimono, sukiyaki and noodles.  We tried their Omakase dinner as they got fresh shipment arrived that day.  It very fresh and delicious and we enjoyed a lot.   We like the best is the 三合饭 which is not in the menu.  It don with chopped salmon, tuna belly, salmon roe and sea urchin roe.  贅沢 "Zeitaku" translated as luxury and extravagance.   The otoro is also equally good and really melt in your mouth

address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 2 #01-21 Tampines, Singapore Singapore
comment: This is an okay place. I didn't order anything fancy but I think it's better done elsewhere for this particular food(saboten). Venue is so so in decor and not a fan how cold this place is. Is it for the sushi? I don't like rushing to eat my food but it's losing optimal temp very quickly. Service is nice though.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 2 #01-21 Tampines, Singapore Singapore
comment: For the past two years, I have been coming To Mikawa every time I come to Singapore for business which is about 4 times a year. I also held business lunches often. Today, as usual I ordered chef's special sashimi, S$45. In the past, I could tell the chef took pride in the arrangement and choices. I never got the same choices but never was disappointed either until today. Today, I got 5 pieces of typical fish with a scoop of ikura. I asked if chef changed and got told a new chef took over. I guess, I won't be coming back to Mikawa anymore.

Value for money budget steak with all you can eat salad and fries.Despite the Brazilian name, it's more of a steak frites place. The owners of this restaurant are French. The menu is simple, S$19.90 gets you a sirloin and unlimited fries and salad. To upsize your steak, pay $5 extra.By all means it's not the best steak, you get what you pay for, really. Beef quality is only a small notch above Aston's or Jack's place. Fries are crispy out of the fryer, and for the salad, you get butter lettuce instead of iceberg lettuce. If you're in the mood, they do serve caipirinhas. :)4 stars cos it's value for money, but don't come in here expecting Morton's or Ruth's Chris. The food quality is only 3, but on a day when you crave steak, it's fine, really.

I'm really really surprised that this place hasn't gotten more notoriety on Yelp.  Braseiro is a fantastic French grill in the the heart of Joo Chiat Road. The best deal on the menu is easily the signature Meat (you are getting the steak, no questions asked) served with an UNLIMITED supply of French fries and fresh lettuce.  P.S I wish they replaced the French fries with rice, kidding! Clearly, this is not an Asian restaurant :-)For doneness of my meat, I chose medium-rare. The rib eye steak came out fantastic. I had no idea the French could grill! You also have the option of three sauces: mango, mustard and chipotle to mix with your steak and fries. Don't fret, if there is no seating space on the first floor. There is a large 2nd floor with another set of 8 dinning tables or more. it's a bit neat to see expats living in the neighborhood playing a card game of sorts on the second floor during the evening. The big surprise is that there is a beautiful terrace in the back that accommodates 20 or more people, if you are keen for a fun night amongst friends under neath the stars and in an enclosed outdoor setting.Four stars for the price - $20 for char grilled steak and unlimited homemade fries and the fact you won't find this type of restaurant anywhere else on Joo Chiat or anywhere else on the East Coast for that matter.

I firmly believe that what is cheap is not necessarily bad and what is expensive is not necessarily good. At $19.90 a steak I was hoping for adequacy. Did not get it. Soggy fries, gristly steak. About 30% was gristle. We complained, no one cared. Nail on the coffin? The lava cake was cold in the centre. I applaud the chilli mustard. It's a busy restaurant. I wish them well.

Thought it would be weak, but not bad for a French style brasserie. Not exactly Entrecote, but in that similar style. Steak was good, not awesome. Cooked perfect to temp. Fondue was really just melted Brie, but was very tasty and baguette bread was delightful. Service was attentive but not annoying. Fries were good, but I'm not a fan of them. Wine selection was weak, but our Chianti was great. Dessert was a chocolate mousse that was good. Downstairs is limited seating but there's more room upstairs. Definitely recommend for a taste.

user_location: New Port Richey, Tampa Bay, FL
comment: My wife and I went to Braseiro yesterday. It was a great experience. We were greeted and served by the owner. He took great care of us, and the food was good. I like the vibe in the restaurant with the decor and the music also, it is very laid back and not uptight like more formal places that serve steak. The steak was good, the fries were good, the cheese fondue and desert were also good, but what we enjoyed the most is our conversation with the owner. We had a great time!

I could eat here EVERYDAY!! My favorite place to eat on Joo Chait!  I love Braseiro!! Ran by a young couple, you really  feel like you are going to a friends house for some amazing BBQ. The prices are great and the meat is always cooked to perfection! Ohhhh... And free flow salad and fries, what more do I need to say!

Ordered 3 steaks and 1 chicken. Chicken is good & tasty. 1 piece of steak has too much gristle. The other 2 are ok. Ok quality, I went there with higher expectations because of the 4 stars, but not expecting Ruth's Chris level. Came out disappointed. Gave us a tiny bowl of salad for 4 person though can ask for more. Fries are too soggy. Won't be back again for sure

Decent steak with free flow of fries (super addictive) and salad. Nice chill out place and very good service given that I only see the owner serving!! Always checking each table timely and we don't really have to call him to get something or to be served.

Love love LOVE this place! Found it online while in Singapore. My mum and I were craving a steak. We took an Uber over to Braseiro. 2 storey little place, cute terrace on the second floor. The owner was so sweet...she is french, she and her boyfriend opened the restaurant, combining elements of french food (think steak frits in a Paris brasserie) and Brazilian ( think perfect Caipirinha in a bar in Rio). The steak was cooked perfectly..the homemade fries were to die for. Did I mention how delicious the Caipirinhas are?? Now for the kicker: $19.90 for the 200g steak and the fries and salad are bottomless! So glad we came here...you should too!!

I really want this place to succeed. In a neighbourhood overwhelmed with burgers, fish and chips, EPL, and $15 beers, this is a welcome alternative. Prices are almost suspiciously reasonable for an area that seems to try its hardest to out-expensive Holland Village. The menu is simple and we like that: Choose your meat, and get unlimited fries and salad with it. Don't be fooled by the small downstairs space, they have an upstairs, both indoors with aircon as well as a small roof terrace. Upstairs is quieter, Joo Chiat isn't exactly a pedestrian zone. Owners and staff are nice and helpful and give the place a personal touch. Food is good. Another plus: They're open until late, including the kitchen. I believe there's food until midnight. There's many food choices in this part of town, but this brings something new to the mix.

Best rapport price/quality for a red meat restaurant in Singapore, extra !This restaurant, just opened recently in a shophouse in the center of joochiat.IF you go there, it's for meat, and eat a really good steak with french fries and salad free flow.For chicken lover, there is also but according to me, best to order red meat.Price are affordable (less than 30sgd) and you can choose your meat size (200/300/400 g) and how it will be cook, and are includ GST.On the final bill, no GST, only service charge add.Don't think you go there and find the same food as other meat restaurant like Ashton (serving steak too cook and hard). Here all the meat is very tender and the cooking as requested.To recommend

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: I love their collagen broth! Super rich and flavorful. Service here is pretty good, although I do find the bowing a little too excessive :/ The fried beancurd skin is delicious - simply dip it into the broth for 2 seconds for the perfect texture!PS. Make sure you make a reservation as they limit you to 90min of dining time. Recommended!

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: I'm appalled by the nonchalant nature of the wait staffs! They were like "whatever" upon us alerting them to a LIVE CRAWLING COCKROACH, immediately when we were being seated! They did not even offer to switch our table immediately or anywhere close to being apologetic....right about then, another group of diners came in and was as shocked as we were! I RARELY make a fuss or "complained" about things in a restaurant unless it's HEALTH RELATED. My standards are raised even further as we are or were about to  dine in a Paradise Group's chain of restaurants! Please note this is an unbiased review as I'm a member of the Paradise Group patrons, not limited to, of course. Sadly, I'll never stepped foot in that "beauty in the pot" located in Kinex ever again! Please see attached pic...video's available upon request as well.

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: When my friend and I rocked up on a Saturday evening they quoted us 4 hours waiting time. However, my friend charmed the waitress in giving us an earlier slot but in the end, the wait was still 1 hour.We went for the double pot and I found the broth quite thick and filling (probably the collagen). In the end, I believe I prefer the regular broth they have at other steamboat places.The food was ok but nothing spectacular, I found the beef a bit disappointing in quality but the pork was quite good. The pork balls with cheesy filling were my fave.Overall, we spend around 60$ a person which I found a lot for an average hotpot place. Not really worth the wait or the money.... there are other cheaper and better places to get your hot pot fix!

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: This is a MUST TRY if you are a steamboat fan. Particularly if you are a lady, or who enjoys the thick collagen soups, you have to come. Be prepared to make a well-advanced reservation as the place is super packed each time I tried to make a booking.The soup itself is the main star. All the other dishes were decent, if not a little expensive. But good quality definitely so at least your money would be well spent.I tried the special fish tofu - interesting and delicious. The shabu pork and beef were good as well!

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: The best hotpot! Everything is fresh and the fried beancurd skin is the must try!

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: The soup is amazing. Wonderful service. I'll definitely come back here, despite the LONG wait for a table.About 50-60 per person, which makes this kinda pricey for hot pot, but for its taste blast, totally worth it.

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: Great food and service. Nice environment and suitable for families. The food is nicely placed and soup tasty. Prices are on the high side. It is opened till 1am! However, I won't not recommend for group gatherings or outings. Reason being the restaurant has a 90min dining time limit. Imagine finding another place to talk when the time runs out...

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: The worst service I ever experienced in my life. I will never ever give a bad review but this place is really bad. Service staffs damn rude. Food not fresh. Soup all diluted. Tried this place twice and gave me food poisoning twice. Eat at ur own risk.

Updating to five stars. Truly a one of a kind place in Singapore. Their flavors are in point. Excellent cocktail menu to boot. Great ambience as well with all three floors having a distinct vibe. Get the goat curry and any dish which comes with the curried avocado. You won't be disappointed.

Elegant décor (especially the upper floors). Nice African ambient music. Friendly service from a waitress with a brand new iPhone 11 Pro Max. We were the only guests for lunch on a weekday, yet the food took 30 minutes to come out. It is good, but portions are small, for the price (around $30++). Mobutu's heirs can afford to come to Utu, but not Mobutu's mob.
Wonderful breakfast experience! Loved the chicken peanut curry and the speciality coffees. Staff was attentive and polite. Will definite be back again to check out their dinner scene.

This is an absolutely fantastic place to go for breakfast. Their coffee is amazing, so be sure to order some of their specialty ones. I don't remember the name of it, but one had salted peanut butter on the rim of the cup and was really good. All of their breakfast items were excellent. Even if you just go for a coffee, be sure to order the little coconut donuts to go with. It's an easy walk from the main street in Chinatown called Tajong Pagar. Plus, the AC is nice and frosty  :)

I enjoyed it. Bit of a surprise as I didn't know about this place, happened to walk by it when hungry.I walked in on a weekday lunch hour and found the place just opened for the day. Ordered the Avocado Toast dish and an iced americano then took a seat out in the garden patio area.They brought out the plate and it was just beautiful to look at, almost didn't want to eat it. This easily was the best tasting (and looking) Avocado Toast I've ever eaten. Highly recommend.Although having the main entrance on the side street is a bit of a nuisance. Otherwise it's a great cafe to hang and grab a bite!

Great spot for a delicious bite to eat, breakfast, brunch, or lunch. Nice ambiance on the front patio, and an upstairs area with sitcom for the hot days.The food doesn't disappoint, and lots of greenery growing on the modern cement walls.

Very chill ambiance with beautiful aesthetics. The food here is delicious, and they had a lot on their menu that I wanted to try. We went around brunch time and my husband got the soft shell crab burger. It was very tasty. I got the salmon tartine which was beautifully presented and equally as delicious.

Looks great from the pics and menu online. We arrived and got a seat right away, however when we ordered, most things were sold out and the waitress stated that our food would take 50 min (Eggs and French toast) - why it would take so long boggles my mind. We decided to order drinks and leave. Bad business if they have such a problem w/cook times and turning tables.
the place is absolutely beautiful - everything from interior design and the way each dish is plated. great attention to details, and the food tasted great too!will definitely come back to try more

Although the place is quite crowded on weekends, the great service and ambience makes up for it! There is not GST/service charge so you pay whatever is on the menu. The outside of the cafe makes for a good backdrop for outfit photos too.

You can really feel a connection with the staff here, you enter a cosy and warm cafe that serves excellent food and drinks.Pros: Books, pool table, cigars and great whisky. Cons: Not closer to my home

We visited this place because we read about their Truffles promotion. The decor certainly is very impressive with books neatly arranged from wall to wall and old phones decorated at various locations. The ambience is great for catch up with friends over a drink. We've ordered our main courses all from the promo menu and truffle Parmesan fries. It took close to 20 mins before the fries arrived followed by pasta and burger. The Pork neck grill took another 10 mins to be delivered. Sadly, the burger and the Pork neck was more salty than needed while the pasta is blend. We are more sad that with all the truffle shavings on the pasta and pork neck, we can't smell the truffles. Which is very unusual as this is not the first time we've had truffle dishes. Even with the promotion, each dish is about $28. And for that price, I don't see the value when I have the 3 small pieces of pork neck done like schnitzels, topped with creamy sauce and potato chips that occupied half of the plate. We couldn't finish our food because I get tired chewing the pork neck and the pasta was too blend to warrant anymore consumption. The saving grace is the burger because it's not too big and, the parmesan fries has a very nice truffle mayo dip. I really want this place to work out better for customers because they are in a very nice location and the decor is great! I re

We were on our way to another cafe but spotted The Reading Room enroute. The charming facade looks cozy and enticed us to make a quick stop to view the place.We ended up staying for an hour and a half!Very cozy atmosphere with unique, vintage-like decoration. The coffee was average in quality but the atmosphere was the pull factor for us to return the next time.Book lovers will rejoice as the place is a good, quiet hide-out from the busy world to have a cuppa and to have a good reading session. For those who want a place to chill out with friends and catch-up, there's a bigger seating area at the back for big groups. Board games and card games are also available and placed discreetly on the bookshelves - the trick is to be the first to find them!Will definitely recommend this place to friends.

The Reading Room is really an interesting quirky cafe for some good drinks & reading time. We visited this cafe for a Sunday brunch after making a reservation, although the reservation was not a necessity! The moment you step inside the cafe, all the books arranged give you a very good vibe & make you feel you are in a library. They have lot of books of varied interests. We saw some of them even working on laptops or reading books for hours. The staff is really very friendly. One cannot visit this place with less time as it's a laid back cafe vibe with slow service. We ordered Eggs Benedict with portobello & Parmesan crisps and Smashed Avocado with Smoked salmon with Matcha latte & orange juice. While Matcha & juice was tasty & fresh, the food was bland. The food was very mediocre, no taste but it was fresh. This restaurant can be a gem only with better food service, hence did not deserve the 5 star. Overall it's an amazing place to read some books over coffee/tea with no time constraint!

coffee, restaurant and tapas bar near outram MRTthe bookshelves  which decorates the place  gives a very pleasant and imitate atmosphere.There is another room just besides used for event.Food : 3/5We had some tapas and Burger to shareThe tapas are nice, a bit small.I had better burgerService : 4/5Nice people and owner is really coolValue : 3/5A bit pricy for the place.Atmosphere : 4/5Tables are too small for dinner.Not very convenient It is a better coffee place than a restaurant

This is by far one of the most interesting places I've seen in Singapore... Set up to look like a library, The Reading Room has a varied selection of books to read (and to purchase) while being a full functioning café. I only went for afternoon drinks and was delightfully surprised by very nice happy hour offerings, on glasses of red and white wine as well as on beers, and other drinks. It did look like it had a nice brunch menu, and their burger offerings for dinner looked quite nice. At around 6:30 PM however, they shut off most of the lights, which I think was a real mood killer. No need to have lighting resembling that of a sketchy club, when you are in a nice café where people want to go to talk each other, and in fact, see each other too.

One of the most reasonable priced seafood restaurant that I have gone to.I always come here when I have a gathering with family and friends for special occasion.To start off, order the Drunken herbal prawns which comes in a claypot and its swimming in a herbal soup that taste just right amount of herbal infusion (wolf berries included). Just thinking of it making me hungry again...Next, Yong Chow fried rice (fried with shrimps & chopped up char Siew)...& small deep fried squid in dark sweet sauce (very crispy) super yummy.Now comes the mains, like chilli crab & side order of man tao. The chilli is done just the right spiciness & sweetness too, and the Man Tao to dip into it is wonderful.Oh yes, throw in a plate of Sambal Kang Kong for some fiber in your diet.Most of the dishes comes in S/M/L plate size depending on the number of pax or how hungry you are!They have other seafood choices too like frog legs, Geoduck, fresh fish, clams....Bon Apertit.

Awesome happy hour under the tent during the afternoon rain with a $9 pitcher of beer and some snacks. Dinner was great but I really wish they would figure out how to give the true Chinese menu experience to one or 2 people. Portion sizes are for sharing and it is very difficult to have dinner for one. Still extremely fresh and delicious.

Stumbled upon this place by accident (my mother wanted to celebrate my husband's birthday at a now-defunct, Roosevelt - moved), and it definitely exceeded my expectations. They had free flow mimosas, and judging by the happy (and loud) Japanese group next to us, they were good. They're kind of like a tapas place, so some of their portions may seem a bit small, but it's so you can order a greater variety of food to try!The food was real super! I had the sea urchin with cauliflower purée brioche (SUPER TASTY! strongly recommend) and the lobster roll (the bun was well done, and the fries were crispy). My family also tried the Mac&Cheese balls (creamy!), mushroom and burrata (cant go wrong with burrata!!), fish & chips (really generous for the small portion), carbonara, buttermilk fried chicken (I dare say this was the best fried chicken I've eaten ever), and the wagyu steak. They also make a mean panna cotta and churro!Recommend: BUTTERMILK FRIED CHICKEN

This place is one of my favorite places to have brunch in Singapore: great food, good service and fun atmosphere!I came here two Sundays in a row and although the staff was not completely the same team, the service was always super friendly and prompt.I love their reasonably priced oysters and their selection of brunch cocktails - the DIY Bloody Mary is a hit, even without the ranch dressing.Their dishes are well executed and show a freshness which is often difficult to find, especially on brunch menus. Heck, they even made me fan of their kale dish!

My husband did some research and planned the night of drinking and dinner at basically a one stop shop. Drinks at Gibsons to start, then dinner at HB and night caps at flagship. All conveniently located in the same building.The star was definitely humpback. We ordered oysters, the ones from New Zealand were our favorite. We split several of the tapas style dishes and will forever crave the scallops, cabbage and churros. The ceviche was refreshing and had high expectations of the pork but probably try something new next time. The scallops with bacon and brown butter was unreal. The herb cheese with the roasted cabbage, perfection. And I don't think I've ever ordered cabbage on a menu before. I will definitely try to replicate the whipped salted Caramel style butter and cocoa churro. Such a memorable meal!! Also, had lobster bloody and it was the perfect amount of seafood and spice.Cute ambiance and vibe.

I confess, it's rare I've fallen this hard and this fast for a new restaurant.Even more so when service can be spotty (though they earnestly try), and the cocktails, while good, aren't really up my alley. And while the oysters on offer certainly are fresh and yummy and great value during happy hour (5pm-7pm) or all-night on Mondays... the real food. The proper food. The cooked food. Oh how brilliant it is.It's all small sharing plates, and the menu says order quite a few dishes for just two, but frankly we find that's a little generous. For groups of 4-5, between 8-12 dishes is more than plenty. What's good? Almost everything. Twice I've been and twice I've ordered all the garden dishes. The Brussel Sprouts are to die for. When you pick up everything on the plate you get salty-sweet-charred-heat all in a mouthful. The cabbage too. The burrata has been on fleek each time I've ordered it, and the Snow Crab and Manila Clams have me wiping the dish clean with the awesome bread each. And. Every. Time. I'd give the fish dishes a miss, I tried the tuna, the rainbow trout, and the ceviche and all weren't as impressive as the other offerings. For proteins I like the chicken more than the beef or pork. It's a well-crafted dish... though companions liked the beef very much. The pork was kinda meh. And definitely have desserts. There're only two but both are good solid sweets than really hit the spot. I prefer the panna cotta because it's not as sweet or rich as the chocolate mousse, but if you like a good mousse, this is as good as you'll find anywhere. ANYWHERE. IN THE WORLD. So... y'know. It's called Humpback. That's why you'll have A WHALE OF A TIME. #justsaying

Opened by the owners of Jigger and Pony, this is a relatively new place along Bukit Pasoh Road. There is a choice of outdoor seating but it is prohibitively hot in Singapore sometimes. I made an online booking via a third party website for 5 people on a Monday for 8pm a week in advance, and was surprised that there weren't any tables for 7pm ish. Steffi C and I arrived early, at 730pm and surprise, our table wasn't ready, and we sat outside. We ordered a few oysters but they only came 20 minutes after, when our table was nearly ready. We tried to hurry this Eurasian-looking server for our table but he was sort of... curt. Never mind.The fuss about Mondays at Humpback is because oysters are half price here, all-night. They do have half-priced oysters everyday, but only from 5-7pm, which most working people cannot come on time. You might want to avoid Mondays if you want half-priced oysters and have 5-7pm on another day free.They have a comprehensive cocktail menu, but I prefer my cocktails orders to be taken by a bartender and customized to my preference. We opted for a Riesling on our very nice server's recommendation.Because we were a party of 5, we got a few small plates to share, apart from the oysters. We had the burrata (yum!), gruyere and feta tapioca balls (yum!), brussel sprouts (I felt it was undercooked but my friends liked it crunchy), pork (too pink for my liking), wagyu (not bad), calamari (yum), tuna (we didn't realize it was raw, 3.5/5). The oysters were fresh, sweet, and nobody had the runs after. Not all varieties of oysters were available, as they source whatever is available direct from Washington state, US. I do love my PNW seafood. My peeve about the oysters were that for more than 20 oysters, they had a tiny pot of vinaigrette. Passing the little jar around was quite annoying.The unexpected star of the meal was the chocolate mousse. I will be sure to order my own portion next time I come here. Bill came up to about 75 per person, but we had wine and oysters and many many plates to share. I imagine it would be more expensive on a non-Monday. Book your seats!
Love the seafood here and the food concept. Oysters are fresh and so are the staff, the service is impeccable.

Humpback is one of my favorite places now for oysters and booze and their happy hour is a great deal.  As I am from Seattle, I was drawn to the place as they advertised themselves as a Seattle-inspired restaurant.  So does it feel like Seattle?  Sort of.  I really appreciated the fresh oysters from the Pacific Northwest, and having some West coast brews available.  The small plates are also quite good, and we enjoyed both the hamachi ceviche and calamari.  But the menu is a little all over the place - lobster roll, ceviche, cheese balls, etc. The cocktails are decent, especially at HH prices, but not mind blowing.  And I wish that they had some American wine options as well.  I loved the bright airy space, and it's a great place to start the evening.  Definitely worth checking out!

I am quite impressed with the Knowledable of the servers here.  The lady that helped us was very nice and informed us of her knowledge of the food recommending the seafood sausage.  The food here is very good indeed, however they do not have the world perspective since they do not know about horseradish sauce or cocktail sauce.  It's great in a pinch, especially for a oyster bar in Singapore this is as good as it gets.

I love oysters, though they have been more of an indulgence in Singapore because they are so overpriced here! Until the day that I found out about this place through Natalie H. "Oysterssssssssss" was all she said, and I was in. The $2-$3 oysters (5-7pm on weekdays+saturday, all day on mondays) drew me to this place, but what really made me like it were the sides that we got. They're the guys behind Sugarhall in Telok Ayer too, which also has excellent sides, and I wasn't disappointed here.I really cannot find another bad to say about the sides we got. Well ok the pork was a bit pink, not sure if that was on purpose but I did recall someone at work (I'm in healthcare) telling me that you should NEVER eat raw pork and hence my fork stayed far away from THAT dish. Otherwise, the burrata, feta tapioca balls, wagyu, calamari, brussel sprouts and tuna were all excellent. I think I might come back just for the sides next time. The sides were bigger than I expected, enough for each person in a group of 5 to get a taster portion and just a bit more.Service was... well they were really crowded and busy on a monday and MAYBE there was just one poor guy shucking oysters because that's the only reason I think of to explain why the oysters took so long to come?I'll still come back though. Maybe not on a monday night.
Stopped by on a whim.  Oysters were excellent.  Nice atmosphere, good bar.  Recommend it for a solid teaser before a night out.

Finally a legit oyster bar in Singapore! We went during happy hour (5-7pm) and all oysters on the menu were for $3 a shuck. Variety of 3 oysters were available and served with lemon, horse radish and vinaigrette. Great service; knowledgable and super friendly staff. Our server told us about the oyster farm in DC where they order their oysters from. We were told that Hama Hama oysters are a staple on the menu, happy to hear as they're definitely a winner. Side dishes were delightful, we ordered the bread with beets mole and the burrata. Beers on tap were great and the wine selection was vast. We'll definitely be back for more! FYI they've just started a Sunday brunch menu and will have oyster happy hour during brunch service as well.
Great nice oysters from US but missed those big fat juicy ones from Seattle. It's not a bad place to chill with friends

Buzzy ambience, great seafood, and awesome service. Lovely brunch spot.  We had:1) Fried Egg ($14) with a sunshiny octopus-laced orzo, and spiked with tete de moine: The sous vide egg , breadcrumb-coated and fried to a beautiful crisp, stayed perfectly soft-boiled on the inside. Excellent execution. A signature here, and for gd reason  2) Strictly as a matter of preference, I preferred the Scrambled Egg ($10): the eggs were very well done, fluffy and moist, and complemented with asparagus, prosciutto, and toasted sourdough  3) I'm not the biggest fan of lobster, or mayo, so I was surprised by how much I liked Humpback's tobiko-flecked Lobster Roll ($39), rich and buttery and creamy and meaty  4) Buttermilk Fried Chicken ($10) with sriracha: typical American South soulfood. Delicious.

I couldn't have been more excited when I heard that the Impossible Burger was coming to our shores. I've tried their competitor before and was looking forward to how good the impossible patty really was and it did not disappoint! Impossible Chedda ($23.00)This was such a delight to have. It still baffles me how they managed to get it looking, tasting and feeling so much like meat when it's all plant based. The only thing is, I wished the added less ketchup. It did feel like they were trying to mask whatever non-meatiness there was but having tasted the patty on its own, I think it would have handled itself just fine. The other parts of the burger was great too. The brioche bun was beautifully toasted yet remained soft and fluffy while the onion purée & pickles gave it an extra lift. Overall a fantastic burger Burning Rice ($18.00) The burning rice was pretty interesting too. A great option for friends who need something more asian while bearding to a burger joint. The rice had a good spice added to it and it's interesting that they serve it with a burger patty. Be warned though, it's a pretty big bowl of carbs!Sticky Icky Wicky ($7.00)Finally! A sticky date pudding done right. Too many times I've ordered a sticky date pudding or sticky toffee pudding in Singapore and it was a let down. This on the other when an absolute delight to have. It's warm, sticky, sweet, yummy. The kind of dessert that warms your heart and soul while you swallow it. Contrast that with the ice cold ice cream it's served with and it was absolutely yummy. Overall, we loved the place. The food we tried were really good and I will definitely be back. And yes, for the Impossible Burger.

Love the vibe and that the different floors have different personalities. Be sure to check out the rooftop. There isn't much of a view but the vibe is great and feels breezy and cool at night. Something to think about especially if you're concerned about dining indoors due to Covid. You can also order to go at their window on the bottom floor if you just want to try.

A venerable institution on KS Road, Potato head is one of the perennially popular places in the city. We had gone at 4pm on a Sunday, and still had to wait an hour. The 3 buns brand serves up an interesting choice of burgers (including recently added Impossible meat range). Good place to go with a group of friends to hangout and chill.

Came here with a group and rented out the second floor - it's complete with a stunning bar in the corner then high top tables in the middle of the space and smaller more traditional seatings flaking the windows. They had great drinks, and the bartender worked well making them quickly and correctly for our large party. They began with appetizers of fried chicken, corn fries, and truffle fries as well. All were absolutely delicious yet could have been a bit warmer in temperature. Then for the meal they brought out trays of their various burgers. My favorite was the BBQ Bacon burger, although the regular and chicken were also delicious. We ventured up to the very buys rooftop bar on the 3rd floor which had nice views of the city.  They successfully execute their take on elevating dishes such as burgers, fries, and fried chicken to a level where you feel a bit upscale eating them.

Jamming to Jamaica Funk as we came in, this hip hop spot in the heart of Chinatown looks a tad rundown and shady as you walk through it's relatively concealed entrance. Up one flight of stairs is small, intimate club like room teeming with activity. Known for its burgers, there was a wide assortment of exotic choices. I decided on the Watermelon Man with house fries. Now who puts watermelon on a burger??? Potato Head does! And now, so do I! Moist and juicy, the beef patty was deliciously accented with the cool sweetness of the melon, which contrasted very well with the spicy house made ketchup. Frankly, the 8oz burger was not enough as I scoffed it down! I absolutely love this place and will be back when I find myself in Singapore!

We came here in a group of 11 with reservations made. The food (mostly burgers) on level 2 (Three Buns) was good but not worth the price. I shared the Smoking B-Boy which was 150gm of beef patty with bacon and cheese and fried shallots (bawang goreng). The fried shallot was nice, gave a different dimension to the beef. For $28++, you just get a burger and nothing else. No sides or anything. I had a lemonade jerk which came with slices of grapefruit and lemon. It was fizzy and not too sweet. I could taste the slight bitterness of the grapefruit. I tried the sticky date pudding which was not bad but came in a tiny container. I nicked a bit of the "chili fries" which was also not too bad. The food is generally ok, but the service could be better or flexible. To be fair, it was only one wait staff who was that. The others were quite lovely. I was taken aback when the said wait staff flatly refused to do individual billing even before we ordered especially when we were a big group. Many eateries have started doing individual billing as it just made it easier for everyone instead of wasting time trying to figure out the cost. I have also been to places when they can spilt the bill even when it was just 2 persons dining. They need to play catch up in this aspect. The same wait staff was also very adamant about us hurrying up (close to 30 minutes of our arrival and we were settling in and looking at the menu, taking pictures and just trying to decide on what to order) in placing our order and telling us we need to vacate in an hour time. Again we were stunned. Never have I been to a place where the staff would actually say that. Usually if there is a time limit on the table, they would inform us once we got seated. Not after 30 minutes and then saying we have one hour to place order and eat. Thank goodness our efficient organizer kept the email reservation where it clearly stated our timing. It was for 2 hours, and if the kitchen cannot handle big group orders, then maybe they should not impose a time limit in the first place. And the place was fairly empty when we were there, definitely not full house with a line waiting outside. Another wait staff spilled my drink (too generous and filled to the brim) on me and my cloth bag (my ipad is inside!) but he was so apologetic and concerned that I just waved it off. And thank goodness it was a cloth bag so it was totally washable. I am not sure if I will return as the burgers were not spectacular (I would rather go to Roadhouse or &made or DB Bistro) and that antsy eager beaver wait staff certainly marred the experience in wanting us to just order, eat and go.

Spent my evening here and went up to the rooftop bar. The atmosphere's really awesome, it has a really beautiful view of the city. It might be a little sunny if you arrive there around 5pm. Got the truffle cheese fries, impossible cheddar, baby huey, mojito and a beer. Foods great although it may be a little expensive. They have a DJ there too and the music's fantastic :-) Overall, 10/10 I would recommend!!!!
Good hangout spot - nice vibes, centrally located. The burgers/sliders here are quite good. Drinks are ok / average - decent beer selection but cocktails are generally too sweet or watered down.

A really gorgeous interior and a fun rooftop if you can manage to survive the Singapore heat (or get lucky enough to go on a 'breezy' night).In all reality, the drinks and food are quite overpriced. I've only had their bucket of beers because it's the most decently priced item on their menu, but if you were to come here without money to blow, it's to enjoy the rooftop with good company in a really loud atmosphere. Start your night here and venture off somewhere else.

Da Cheese Master ($21 incl. GST and service) - 3.5 starsGood but it's not quite $21-good given that the burgers aren't big and don't come with anything on the side. The beef patty was moist and there was an option for a wholemeal bun, but I couldn't quite taste the whole wheat.Ambience - 4 starsCute, and we stayed around to chat after lunch. I'd come here with a group, not just for the food.Service - 3.5 starsI've heard bad things about the service. This time, the waiter wasn't too friendly when taking our order but as the crowd thinned he warmed up, so perhaps customers were being demanding.
Really like this place,  the vibe is cool a bit loud though so not a place for a quiet dinner.  Burgers are tasty, the buns are good as well. The crack a lacka corn wow this is good!!!
It may sound bit harsh, but everything here is absolutely mediocre. The ambience was okay. There's no food item that stands out for me.

Went here as part of quest to find the best burger in Singapore.  This place isn't it.  The burger was just OK, the Baby Huey was slathered in mayo and cheese, and was just... fatty.  No acid or bitter counter points to complement the fattiness.The Naughty Fries (essentially chili chips)  were very good - eat them immediately when they arrive, so that they're still crispy and hot.Regular fries were pretty good.  A little on the mushy side.  Beet salad was meh.  Daiquiri was alright.Atmosphere was terrific, and the front of the house was on point.  But the price is a bit on the high side for what you get.

Love the ambiance and the quirky interior. My cocktail, truffle fries and chicken burger were on point, even if my tinder date wasn't. The darkness of the restaurant helped to mask the awkwardness. I'll be back with better company!

Went to Potato Head Folk with a friend to taste the highly praised burgers there. Indeed, they didn't disappoint. Here's a few things we like aout PHF:1, The food. I ordered the Truff Ryder( a little more expensive than the other options, but so worth it!) and my friend got the Baby Huey burger, which she enjoyed very much too.2, The interior design. We had a great time by just looking at the murals in the building. 3, The service. Staff were friendly and prompt to help, thumbs up.I'm definitely coming back again!

A really gorgeous interior and a fun rooftop if you can manage to survive the Singapore heat (or get lucky enough to go on a 'breezy' night).In all reality, the drinks and food are quite overpriced. I've only had their bucket of beers because it's the most decently priced item on their menu, but if you were to come here without money to blow, it's to enjoy the rooftop with good company in a really loud atmosphere. Start your night here and venture off somewhere else.

Great service, great view, great food Got the chicken burger and that wasn't too fantastic, we also ordered the angus burger was was really really nicely doneFries were great too Cocktails were sweet and slightly weak but great nevertheless for a nice drink Got a rooftop seat and the ambience deserves a thumbs up Though the climb up to the roof could be tiring for some
Great atmosphere and staff, always a pleasure to come here. It's the place to have one more drink after a nice meal. Perfect location.

Really wish they would bring over the same menu as they have in Bali and not just burgers! Still though this place is a gorgeous venue with good vibes on weekends to entertain friends with decent variety (albeit super pricey) of drinks...just be sure to eat somewhere else first!

Ordered 2 Honky-Tonk, 2 drinks and a toffee pudding and we paid $62 in total. The price was exorbitant considering the burger tasted mediocre (nothing special). It had a lovely sauce on in, but just felt that for the price we were paying it should have been bigger or at least come with a side. NOTE: Honky-Tonk was the only chicken burger on the menu, can't speak for the other burgers.We were sitting on the 2nd floor and the place looked nice until the sun went down and it became dark. Would have been a better place to have lunch at instead of dinner in my opinion. We also had to wait 45 mins for our dessert. We were told that the kitchen was busy and that it took awhile to warm the pudding. This would have been okay if the pudding arrived steaming hot which was not the case. Plus, my friend's reservation to the 3rd floor lounge had to be released to someone else as we were still waiting for the dessert. Overall, in my opinion it is overrated and not worth the money. If you are coming for the ambience try coming at in the afternoon or for a early dinner and if you're lucky you would snag a seat at the rooftop bar too.

From the people who brought us Potato Head Club in Jakarta and Bali, comes the smaller, quainter "folkier" version here in Singapore. I like the multi-level venue that offers a different experience depending on the mood you're in.On the bottom, it's a casual outdoor spot where you can take away a burger or scoff it there and then. Past the charming door hosts and up the quirky stairwell painted by Melbourne artist David Bromley, you'll come to the dining area where Burgers and fun pre-mixed cocktails are the order of the day. The staff here are delightful, making recommendations and having a bit of fun with customers. I love their colourful shirts and great attitudes. The burger I tried was pretty bloody delicious, though a little soggy on the bottom by the time I got through eating it. Next time I'd skip the sauces as not only do they create the soggy bun, but they add unnecessary sweetness for this savoury lover.One level up and behind a big black door is a colonial feeling cocktail lounge. Here it's about serious cocktails, both the old school and the modern classics as well as some Potato Head creations. I settled on a Martini and loved the glassware and the delightful handkerchief-like placemat it was sat on. If downstairs is for the young at heart, this space is for proper grown ups... or those of us who like to at least pretend we are.Up one more level and there's a rooftop bar. We didn't experience this as it was a scorching day and I felt as if my face might melt off. On a cool evening, this might just be the pick of the bunch. Guess I'll just have to make another visit, right?

Was here for the September instalment of the Yelp brunch. I'd picked this place as it promised good food in an interesting location, and the decors (designed by some Australian guy with a fear of flying...) had been much hyped about.Good things first: The decor was really quite impressive. We were seated at the Three Buns restaurant (second floor) and blue floral designs decorated the walls with artfully mismatched furniture and quirky statues, lending a whimsical vibe to the area. Most guests are seated in comfy-looking couches surrounding low tables, but our group of 14 got the large communal dining table in the middle of the room. The stairwell featured checkered tiles and more interesting statues/paintings, and the bar on the third floor reminded me of a 1900s Gentleman's bar- dark woods, heavy furniture, the most amazing collection of liquor in bottles of every kind. It was amazing and one could really appreciate the planning put into the design of this place.HOWEVER, the food was just ok. Yes, this is a burger joint, but we were a bit disappointed that they didn't really have any decent alternatives for those who were craving something else. I mean, usually there would be at least 2 sides which could pass off as a decent meal on its own? But anyway, most of us tried the Baby Huey (beef patty), Honky Tonk (chicken), 4 stories (double beef patty)... The verdict was that the Honky Tonk was the best due to the excellent pairing of the buttermilk chicken fillet and tangy coleslaw. We tried the Naughty Fries (potato spuds with salsa and a hell lot of parsley) and Sticky Date pudding too. My fries were alright, luckily not as bad as the one that Natalie had. The Sticky Date pudding was good but the portion was TINY for $8.Bad things last: The service was pushy and hurried. We had a reservation from 1230-1430, and while we did take SOME time to order, there was this guy who kept on rushing us and telling us that we had to get out by 2pm... He must have said it at least 4 times in 10 minutes. (Turned out that they got the timing wrong, we left before 1430 anyway) Yes, I know that you're popular, yes, I know that you have tables to turn, but it could have been conveyed in a less authoritative tone. I'm not sure if they even apologised after we informed them that they had gotten the end-time of our reservation wrong.Would I come back? Maybe... But a return visit isn't near the top of my agenda now.

Loud. Pricey. Overrated? I'm guess most people head to Potato Head Folk because it's a pretty cool place to be seen at. Interior design is cool. It's loud and vibrant. There's a rooftop bar. It's a cool place. But on the two occasions I went there, I found myself being pretty disappointed with the food. Overall all I can say was that the food was nothing special. It was not terrible but not quite worth the 20+++ price tag for a burger. The homemade cola and all were pretty undrinkable to most of us who ordered it. The service was bleh as well. I ain't gonna say much about this because I used to work in F&B and understand how it gets on the flip side. But bleh. Could be much better overall. It's alright. Nothing super and not a place you'd return to twice with the options we have in Singapore today.

Just amazing! The food at excellent quality and the staff super Friendly and kind! Great place to hang out and eat some good burgers! Definitely bringing all my friends and family here ! Grate job! The deco is on point ! Something different! The only thing that actually bothered me was that the music was just a bit too loud for conversation so we had to nearly shout out order but apart from that all good !

Went to Potato Head Folk with a friend to taste the highly praised burgers there. Indeed, they didn't disappoint. Here's a few things we like aout PHF:1, The food. I ordered the Truff Ryder( a little more expensive than the other options, but so worth it!) and my friend got the Baby Huey burger, which she enjoyed very much too.2, The interior design. We had a great time by just looking at the murals in the building. 3, The service. Staff were friendly and prompt to help, thumbs up.I'm definitely coming back again!
Great burgers. Even better rooftop bar with some special cocktails and building views.

Such a cute kitschy place. Love the decor. Love the rooftop tiki bar. The feel was perfect despite the heat. What's not great? The crappy drinks they call cocktails. My Siak Daiquiri tasted like detergent. At $25 a pop, I expected a decent drink. Something refreshing. It was just full of syrup, stingy with the alcohol and just a bad taste altogether. I was bummed because it's such a lovely looking place. So I gave it a chance and asked if I could change my drink because I absolutely hated this dishwater. The server refused saying it was just probably not to my liking and they couldn't help if I don't like it. They would however add more yuzu syrup to make it taste better. I appreciated that gesture but I did not appreciate her reasoning. Some people sitting next to me overheard our conversation and told me this happened to them earlier too and they were told nothing could be done. So they left most of their drinks untouched. What a pity. Everyone just writes it off as bad customer service in Singapore. But I say, it's a top down issue. If the management don't educate and empower their staff, service staff will never bother to make savvy decisions on their feet. Until then... Drink up your lousy drink!

I'm updating my review since I went back a second time for food.Previous reviews are spot on. The food is way too expensive. I spent $20 for a tiny burger. It would be a different story if this was Potato Head in Bali where you're captive in one club without other food options, but there are plenty of nearby eateries where you could get better bang for your buck. And the fries? Meh. They're not even fries. The food did not impress me one bit.I still regard the decor as top-notch and the rooftop area is still one of the best al fresco dining areas in Singapore.

Burger was spot on for flavor. I typically choose a burger with cheddar, bacon and bbq sauce. The Smokin BBoy delivered on it. However, the price at $18 is pretty outrageous. Especially because the burger is only 120g. Naughty fries are pretty delicious but are 10$. So a $30 burger and chips set. The rooftop garden is really nice for conversation and atmosphere. 3* for value. 4* for taste. 4* for ambiance.

One of the best burgers I have had in Singapore only because I haven't been able to find a half decent burger around. We had the Burning Man ($24) - the burger in itself had an overpowering taste of the Jalapeno relish. The bun was nothing special - it neither reduced or enhanced the taste. Left me needing a huge bottle of ice water to wash down the taste.Honkey Tonk ($18) - the chicken was done impeccably well. Was crisp, tender and moist. Again, the bun was just a filler. Personally, not a fan of chicken burgers but the execution of this was pretty good. Likely to go back for this one.Finished off with a Sticky Icky Wicky ($8) - was moist and was not too sweet. Coupled with the fresh cream topping, it was nice and balanced and easy on the palate. The ambience was great. The entire Duxton Hill area has a nice vibe to it and I loved the setting of the entire place. However, the service was really bad. From the girl at the counter who was in an extremely sour mood, to our server who cold shouldered us the whole night.
